title: AI Utvecklare
description:
**AI Utvecklare**

**Är du redo att forma framtiden genom att omvandla information till värde?**

Sogeti strävar efter att hjälpa våra kunder genom både strategiska och operativa förbättringar. Vi tror på att utmana befintliga lösningar för att göra dem effektivare och att använda de senaste teknologierna för att skapa värde genom moderna tillämpningar som GenAI.


**Din roll**  

Sogeti söker AI-experter som vill vara med och driva området i Stockholm i samarbete med kollegor i övriga landet och världen. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, tekniskt skicklig och driven att förbättra och effektivisera verksamheter. Vi vill att du ska vara en lagspelare som är bra på att arbeta i team men även på att leverera på egen hand. Du är utåtriktad och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna. Att hjälpa kunder att identifiera användningsfall och skapa största möjliga värde är något du brinner för.  



  

**I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i**

* Tillämpa stora språkmodeller (LLM) på specifika affärsproblem för att extrahera, bearbeta, klassificera och härleda insikter från ostrukturerade datamängder
* Utveckla domän- eller uppgiftsspecifika språkmodeller för affärsproblem när befintliga modeller inte kan användas
* Utvärdera prestandan för maskininlärningsmodeller och ge rekommendationer för förbättringar
* Hålla dig uppdaterad kring kärnteknologier inom NLP och generativ AI
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och ta gemensamt ägarskap och ansvar för planering, arbete, kvalitet och leverans
Agera mentor till juniora teammedlemmar för att bidra till en miljö där de får utvecklas genom stöd och support  
* 

  

**Din profil**

* Akademisk examen inom Data Science, Data, Machine Learning, Theoretical Linguistics eller motsvarande
* Praktisk erfarenhet av stora språkmodeller (GPT, XLNet, T5, etc.)
* God erfarenhet av att använda moderna NLP-verktyg och bibliotek som spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers
* Goda kunskaper i Python-utveckling inklusive bibliotek som NumPy, SciPy och erfarenhet av SQL
* Duktig på att kommunicera och lära ut, förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med både on-prem och molnplattformar, MS Azure är meriterande
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av vektordatabaser som Pinecone, Milvus eller Weaviate är meriterande

**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**

* **Innovativ miljö** : Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation
* **Karriärutveckling** : Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv
* **Flexibelt arbete** : Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas
* **Teamkänsla** : Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas

**Ansökan:**

Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Mathieu Vannoorenberghe på mejl: mathieu.vannoorenberghe@sogeti.se


#LI-HB1


**Om oss**  

Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Junior Front End Developer
description:
### **Junior Front-End Developer**


As a Junior Front-End Developer at Mozaiq, your role will be focused and impactful. You’ll be responsible for implementing visually appealing and highly functional web interfaces, specializing in front-end development with Next.js. Your work will directly support how our clients’ brands are communicated online and help achieve their business objectives. You will be an integral part of our international team, working closely with designers, illustrators, and SEO specialists to bring engaging and effective web projects to life.

**Responsibilities**

  

* Build and maintain web applications primarily using Next.js.
  
* Managing the content of websites with WordPress.
  
* Implement responsive web interfaces from Figma designs.
  
* Work closely with designers to style and implement web components.
  
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams across regions to ensure designs meet both visual and functional requirements.
  
* Use Git for version control and smooth collaboration with other developers.
  
* Ensure projects follow Responsive Web Design (RWD) principles.
  
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
  
* Stay up to date with industry trends and contribute best practices to the team.
  

**Requirements**

* Minimum 1 year of professional experience in a similar role.
  
* Familiarity with WordPress CMS is required.
  
* Strong proficiency with React.js.
  
* Experience in Next.js and TypeScript is a plus.
  
* Familiarity with Responsive Web Design (RWD).
  
* Ability to translate Figma designs into functional web pages.
  
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
  
* Excellent communication skills for collaboration in a global team.
  
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  

**About Mozaiq**


Mozaiq is a fully remote team with roots in the US and Eastern Europe. We build powerful, cross-functional teams that support some of the most sophisticated tech and marketing organizations in the world.


Global Family: A tight-knit, multicultural, remote-first team


Meaningful Work: Support world-class brands and products


Inclusive Culture: We prioritize collaboration, clarity, and growth

 **Contractor Benefits**

* Flexible hours (with limited CET–US overlap)
  
* Competitive hourly pay
  
* Exposure to global clients and leading tech brands
  
* 100% remote work

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 As a key member of our team, you'll design, develop, and maintain backend solutions for our Stores. Working in an agile environment, you'll collaborate with product managers, business and frontend engineers to deliver high-quality, scalable software. The ideal candidate is passionate about backend development, proficient in C# and .Net, and stays updated with Microsoft Development best practices.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 
  

  

* API Design: Collaborating on the design and implementation of APIs that facilitate seamless communication between the Mobile Application and backend, ensuring an efficient flow of data in the headless ecommerce environment.
* Databases (SQL/ NoSQL): Contributing to data modelling and database design, optimizing storage and retrieval mechanisms to align with the requirements of a headless ecommerce architecture.
* Azure Cloud: Leveraging your expertise in Azure Cloud services to enhance the scalability, reliability, and performance of our backend systems, ensuring a seamless integration with our headless ecommerce applications.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 At Store Lens, we work closely with Portfolio Brands and H&M Brand to design and provide technical solutions. We contribute to product development at every stage, from setting requirements to rollout and testing. From day one, we focus on improving by listening, building, and refining as we go. Even as we define requirements, we are already thinking ahead, using early designs, first developments, and new learnings to continuously make the product better.
   

  

 We are curious, active listeners and hands-on doers.
   

  

 Beyond your work with Store Lens, you will also be part of our Engineering/QA community, where you will have access to a network of experts, resources, and opportunities to grow.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience), and at least 5-8 years of experience as a Software Engineer with backend focus.
* Proficiency in C# and .NET.
* Proficiency in Azure concepts and native development using Azure functions.
* Experience in concept as Always up and message queuing.
* Experience of CI/ CD pipelines using Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions.
* Experience of containerization technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
* Experience in Database (e.g. Cosmos Db).
* Experience in POS, Payment and Checkout area is a plus.
* Experience in SignalR is a plus.


*And people who have:*
* Continuous learning mindset to stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in backend testing.
* Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and communicate technical concepts clearly.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Experience conducting code reviews, identifying areas of improvement, and provide constructive feedback to maintain code quality and consistency.
* Familiarity in backend testing with a focus on ensuring the reliability and performance of backend systems.
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum development methodologies.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Full Stack React/.NET Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are seeking an experienced
 **Full stack Software Engineer** 
 to join our dynamic team at H&M. In this role, you will leverage your technical expertise across the full Software Development Life Cycle from requirements gathering and system design to development and deployment. You’ll collaborate closely with Product Managers and key stakeholders from Product Development, Engineering, and multiple Value Streams to deliver scalable, high-quality solutions.
   

  

 As part of the
 **Centre of Excellence for Engineering** 
 , you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to various product teams, shaping the future of digital experiences at H&M through innovative, customer-centric technology.
   

  

**In addition to the above, your role will involve:** 

* Design, develop, and implement software solutions aligned with project goals and quality standards.
* Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using best practices and appropriate software design patterns.
* Collaborate with Product Managers, Designers, and other stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for software projects.
* Conduct unit testing, debugging, and troubleshooting to ensure software meets functional and performance expectations.
* Participate in code reviews to provide and receive constructive feedback and enhance code quality.
* Work closely with team members to resolve technical issues and optimize application performance.
* Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends to propose innovative solutions and improvements.
* Contribute to the documentation of software designs, technical specifications, and user manuals.
* Operate effectively in an Agile development environment, participating in sprint planning, estimation, and other team activities.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be joining the
 **Delivery Management Services (DMS)** 
 team, part of the
 **Distribute component area** 
 within the
 **Product and Move unit** 
 at H&M. The DMS team plays a key role in enabling delivery capabilities across our online e-commerce ecosystem for H&M and Portfolio brands. We develop and maintain services that support customer promise delivery, optimize delivery offers, integrate with carrier brokers and carriers for both deliveries and returns, and provide shipment tracking and tracing. As a team, we’re passionate about building scalable, customer-focused solutions that enhance the end-to-end delivery experience.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* At least 5 years of hands-on experience with C#, .NET, Web APIs, and microservices architecture, with a strong foundation in backend development.
* Solid frontend development skills using React.js, Webpack, and modern JavaScript frameworks and tools.
* Proficiency in writing unit and integration tests using frameworks like NUnit/xUnit for .NET and Jest/React Testing Library for React, including experience with mocking tools.
* Working knowledge of Azure services, such as App Services, Azure Functions, Key Vault, Storage Accounts, Service Bus, AKS, AppInsights, and Application Gateways.
* Experience in building and managing CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and implementing Infrastructure as Code with tools like Terraform or Bicep.
* A solid understanding of application and cloud security best practices.
* Familiarity with automated testing frameworks and methodologies, ensuring high-quality and reliable software delivery.
* Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools such as Splunk.


 And people who are…
   

  

* Strong problem-solvers, capable of analysing complex issues and driving effective resolutions.
* Structured and detail-oriented, with the ability to create and maintain clear, well-organized technical documentation.
* Collaborative communicators, skilled at engaging with business users to elicit requirements, clarify needs, coordinate efforts, and walk through solutions effectively.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* Staff discount card: Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* H&M Incentive Program (HIP): Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* Competitive pensions: Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* Generous vacation: 30 days vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* Additional perks: Discounts from Benify.
* Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* Global Impact: Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* Professional Growth: Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* Collaborative Culture: Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Software Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Education: Bachelor's degree or higher
* 5+ years of experience in .NET and C#, with a strong focus on backend development.
* Extensive experience in building and maintaining APIs.
* Well versed with design patterns, oops concepts and SOLID principles.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
* Working knowledge of software architecture like Microservices and Event Driven Design.
* Experience with Cloud Computing (AWS preferred).
* Experience with containerization using Docker and Kubernetes.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


**Meritorious**
* Experience working with Kafka
* Experience working with gRPC services.
* Experience with OAuth2/OpenID Connect.
* Experience in setting up monitoring for infrastructure and applications with tools such as Grafana, Prometheus, and OpenTelemetry.
* C/CE driver´s license.


**Application deadline:** 
 10-10-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Frontend Developer with focus on UX/UI
description:
At Evolution AB / Nolimit City, we're building cutting-edge gaming products that redefine how players experience online entertainment. As we continue to grow, we're looking for a Frontend Developer with a strong UX/UI focus, or a UX/UI Designer with frontend development chops, to join one of our expanding engineering teams.
 



  





 You'll play a key role in shaping the look, feel, and interactivity of products that reach a global audience—contributing not only to how things work but also how they feel. At Evolution, design and development are not siloed; you'll be an essential part of product decisions from day one, working in highly collaborative, autonomous teams.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Design and build intuitive, responsive, and beautiful interfaces with React (Next.js) and TypeScript.
* Bring UX and UI designs to life—from wireframes to pixel-perfect implementation.
* Collaborate closely with product owners and engineers to craft seamless user experiences.
* Own the frontend from concept to production, including performance optimization, accessibility, and maintainability.
* Contribute to our design system and help shape a consistent visual language across products.
* Continuously experiment, iterate, and improve based on real user feedback and data.
* Be part of a team that values learning through iteration, experimentation, and shared responsibility.



  





**You Might Be a Great Fit If You** 



* Have solid experience with React, TypeScript, and modern CSS techniques.
* Possess a keen eye for design details, and care deeply about creating delightful user experiences.
* Enjoy bridging the gap between design and development.
* Are comfortable building advanced components.
* Believe in clean, maintainable code and smooth user flows.
* Have good communication skills in English and love working in a collaborative environment.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* Experience with Next.js, Redux Toolkit, or Headless CMSs like Strapi.
* Understanding of accessibility and web performance best practices.
* Familiarity with UI/UX testing tools or user research methods.
* An interest in gaming or digital entertainment interfaces.



  





**Technologies You'll Touch** 



* React / Next.js
* TypeScript / JavaScript
* Redux Toolkit
* CSS / Tailwind CSS
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Git (GitHub Actions)



  





**Who we are** 




 We care more about your potential than checking every box. If you're excited about building exceptional interfaces and love working in small, empowered teams, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 Join one of Sweden's fastest-growing tech companies and help us craft experiences that players around the world love.
 



  





 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
 



  





 Apply on LinkedIn, or send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
 



  





 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
Are you interested in working on exciting challenges within high transaction environments? We are looking for you who are curious, can take initiative and come up with new creative solutions, and care about ultimately delivering a great product.  
 


  

 The Role
   


 Our Engagement Area in Product Development is growing and we are now looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join! Engagement at Betsson Group ensures our customers come back for more. It’s all about loyalty. We provide a world class customer experience beyond the game play featuring Tournaments, Dynamic personalized campaigns and much more! 
 


  


 You will be part of preparing our journey to containerization, increasing the scalability of our systems while also maintaining their high quality. To accommodate new requirements, we are constantly re-evaluating our systems design and working on exciting new features.
 


  

 You have experience in
   

  
* C#, .NET, .NET Core
  
* SQL Server and NoSQL databases
  
* Unit testing frameworks
  
* Messaging within a micro service architecture
  
* Agile development
  
* Collaboration / knowledge-sharing
  


  

 Extra awesome
   

  
* Kafka
  
* Experience in a modern front-end framework (e.g. Angular)
  
* Docker containerization
  
* Domain driven design
  


  

 What’s in it for you?
   


 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
 


  

  
* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
  
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
  
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
  
* Freedom with responsibility
  


  

 Challenge Accepted?
   


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our tech colleagues are talking about.
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Software Developer
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.*
 At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.
   

  

 Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 Right now, we are looking for a Software Developer for our Digital Domain, supporting the Finance and HR teams. In this role, you will report to the Digital Domain Manager and be part of a cross-functional digital team that ensures our Finance and HR functions have the modern digital capabilities they need to power a cutting-edge steel plant. The team is responsible for enabling Finance and HR to make timely, data-driven decisions by building and maintaining reliable backend services, APIs, and solution architectures.
   

  

 In this role will play a key role in shaping the digital backbone of our finance and HR functions. You will work closely with developers and business teams to build decoupled, flexible microservices that ensure accurate, well-structured data flows across Stegra, from manufacturing to sales and maintenance. You’ll be responsible for designing and operating the services your team provides, while also contributing to the long-term evolution of our digital infrastructure. Ultimately, this role ensures that finance and HR can depend on correct, well-structured, and well-governed data as the foundation for decision-making.
   

  

 Specific to this role, the day-to-day tasks will include the following but as we are a growing company with very little silos between teams, other tasks might be included as well.
   

  

* Design, develop, and operate backend services that are central to Stegra’s success, ensuring they are fast, scalable, and reliable.
* Build and maintain infrastructure, tools, and deployment pipelines that enable efficient development and high-quality delivery.
* Take ownership of the digital capabilities your team provides, from design to operation with a strong focus on reliability and continuous improvement.
* Shape solution architecture and design APIs and data flows that ensure P&O and finance have accurate, well-structured information from across the organization.
* Drive innovation and collaboration by working closely with other development and product teams to enhance our services and deliver real business value.


**What You’ll Bring**
 You bring energy, curiosity, and a thoughtful approach to your work. You care about building things that last, and you enjoy collaborating with others to find practical solutions. You thrive in agile environments and are always open to learning and trying new things both in technology and in how we work together.
   

  

 Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below
   

  

* A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
* Some years of experience in backend development and microservive design.
* Experience building backend services using Kotlin, Java or similar.
* Awareness of best practices such as automated testing and continuous delivery
* Exposure to tools like Kubernetes, Terraform, and event-driven architectures, though a willingness to learn is just as important.
* Experience designing APIs and working with microservices architectures
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate across teams and domains


**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

**Read More About Benefits At Stegra Here.**
**This is Stegra**
 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
   

  

 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
   

  

**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: Fullstack Developer (Node.js, React, AWS)
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a Fullstack Developer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack developer at Qred, you’ll be a part of a cross-functional team together with fellow Qredsters from diverse technical backgrounds. Our teams are carefully structured to promote collaboration and accountability, bringing together developers and UX designers to efficiently solve daily challenges and take ownership of the products we build. This team consist of four other developers, is well-structured and led by an Engineering Manager, Product Manager and Tech Lead, ensuring that everyone is included, aligned and moving in the same direction.
   

  

 We trust in our developer’s capability of implementing, testing, reviewing, deploying daily and operating their software in production.
   

  

**Requirements**
* At least a few years of experience in writing, releasing and maintaining web applications as well as integrations, using the following techs: Node.js, React and Amazon Web Services
* A flexible, positive mindset and a strong team spirit


**What Will Make You Stand Out**
* Familiarity with CloudFormation or CDK
* Hands-on knowledge of CI/CD tools such as Circle-ci, GitHub actions or similar
* Experience with the fintech industry


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

  

  

 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Principal Software Engineer, Product
description:
*Location: Stockholm or New York*
**About Us**
 Work shapes who we are. It's how we grow, contribute, and make an impact. But for many, work still feels like a grind. Even in the digital age, productivity tools often add more friction than flow. Colin and Fabian founded Supernormal because they knew that AI could make work better. Supernormal builds AI-powered tools that streamline workflows, boost collaboration, accelerate impact, and make the super, normal.
   

  

 We started by building one of the most popular AI meeting notetakers out there. Supernormal's first product made meeting prep, notes, and next steps effortless for tens of thousands of teams, and has turned meetings into moments of productivity and genuine connection.
   

  

 Now we're working on something even better — Radiant, an AI tool that will take your unique work superpowers and amplify them.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Who We're Looking For**
 We're looking for a Principal Software Engineer who can pair deep technical expertise with leadership that elevates the entire team. You've guided complex projects from idea to impact, and you know how to set direction without losing sight of the details. You'll be at the center of Radiant's technical future, shaping our AI backend while mentoring others to do the best work of their careers.
   

  

**This is your role if you:**
* Have led large, high-stakes engineering projects end-to-end
* Are comfortable in large Rust, Typescript, and Ruby codebases
* Can provide clarity and direction in ambiguous situations
* Thrive on mentoring and raising the bar for engineers around you
* Balance technical vision with product pragmatism
* Want to move fast and build great things


**What You'll Do**
* Lead development of Radiant, our Rust-based desktop app
* Lead technical planning and decision-making for projects with significant complexity and scale
* Mentor, support, and challenge engineers to grow in their craft
* Partner with product and design to align technical strategy with user impact
* Improve, maintain, and evolve our infrastructure for performance, reliability, and scale


**The Details**
* Full-time role based in Stockholm or New York
* Start date: as soon as possible
* Fluency in English required (written and spoken)
* We care more about your energy and ideas than your CV


**Benefits**
* 💰 Competitive salary
* 📈 Stock options
* 🏥 Full healthcare coverage (Medical, Dental, and Vision)
* 🚀 Totally remote. Not hybrid. Remote. No return-to-office here
* 🏠 WFH budget to make sure you have everything you need to do your best work
* ✈️ Annual team-wide offsite
* 🎓 Education credit (up to $500 per year)
* 🧳 Unlimited PTO (minimum 4 weeks)

title: Game Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Game Development at Coody, you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, in fields such as Games, AR/VR, Music, and other forms of interactive media. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, artists, producers, and product managers.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see every challenge as an opportunity to grow. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year for companies in industries that you’re passionate about.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re after talented game developers who love to build immersive experiences and bring ideas to life. You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy pushing technical boundaries, and want the freedom to work on exciting projects - without the corporate nonsense.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in software development.
* Hands-on experience with building games, VR/AR, or similar interactive experiences.
* Solid skills in modern C++, Lua, AngelScript, or web technologies.
* Experience from Unreal Engine (a bonus).
* A relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or similar.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Full Stack Developer with Focus on Frontend - Solna
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a skilled Full Stack Developer with a strong emphasis on frontend development for a full-time consulting assignment. The ideal candidate will join a cross-functional team working on a new digital feature aimed at leveraging data to create value for end users. In this role, you'll take the lead on frontend development—transforming data into accessible, user-friendly, and visually compelling interfaces. You’ll collaborate closely with UX designers and data teams (AI/BI), while also contributing to backend development tasks when needed to ensure a seamless and complete solution.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop modern, responsive web interfaces using React and TypeScript
* Integrate with REST APIs to retrieve and present data effectively
* Contribute to backend development using .NET/ASP.NET Core
* Ensure high standards in accessibility, performance, and SEO
* Collaborate with UX and design teams to implement intuitive user experiences
* Utilize component-based development and build tools such as Webpack and Storybook
* Manage code via Git and support CI/CD pipelines (preferably via Azure DevOps)
* Work within agile methodologies (Scrum, SAFe), using tools like Jira


**Requirements:**
* Several years of professional experience in frontend development with React and TypeScript
* Proficiency in backend technologies, especially .NET/ASP.NET Core
* Experience working with REST APIs
* Familiarity with tools such as Webpack, Storybook, and Azure DevOps
* Strong understanding of accessibility standards, SEO best practices, and performance optimization
* Experience working with design systems and collaborating with UX/design professionals

title: Jr Product Developer - Womenswear, Shoes
description:
**Job Description**
*Are you passionate about fashion, trends, and have a strong interest in creating and developing a shoe assortment that our customers love?*
*We’re now looking for a driven and curious Junior Product Developer to join our Womenswear Shoes team at H&M. If you thrive in a fast-paced, creative environment and want to grow your skills in product development – this is your opportunity to make an impact and shape the future of our global assortment.*
**What You’ll Do**
 As a Jr Product Developer for Shoes at H&Ms Womenswear department you will have an important role in the exciting and complex process of creating products for ouour collection be sold in all our sales countries – all over the world.
   

  

 Together with a tight team, you work with identifying and developing our shoes assortment according to current and upcoming global trends. Your main responsibility will be to support the Product Developer in creating the best shoes for our customers. This role offers the opportunity to work cross functional, collaborating with a Product Manager, Designers and Planners through the development process. You will be an important link between teams; you will drive the process forward and help ensure seamless coordination between different functions.
   

  

 As a Junior Product Developer, you will be part of our daily operational business, with many ongoing tasks – you will be involved in everything from sample handling, to ensuring our collection are developed according to our strategy.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* At least one year of experience in product development or buying, preferably within fashion or footwear
* A strong interest in shoes and a desire to grow and specialize within this product category
* Relevant education in Textiles, Buying, or Product Development
* A commercial mindset with a strong drive to contribute to business growth
* A deep understanding of the womenswear customer and a sharp eye for fashion and trends
* A structured and organized way of working, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* A collaborative and communicative team player who thrives in a cross-functional environment with a humble and hands-on approach
* A curious mindset and eagerness to continuously learn and develop
* Strong commercial thinking, with the ability to spot opportunities for growth and profitability
* A passion for finding smarter ways of working and driving improvements in everyday tasks


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**JOIN US**
**Additional information:**
 This is a full time position, with placement in Stockholm. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role,
 **please send your application including CV in English as soon as possible.** 
 Interviews will be held continuously. (For internal candidates, please initiate a dialogue with you manager before applying.)  If you are currently in a permanent employment with H&M you will keep your permanent employment even if you take on a temporary position for a limited time.
   

  

**Benefits:**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity:**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.**

title: Backend Developer
description:
***If you’re looking to make the best co-op games in the world, you’ve come to the right place. We're proud to have some of the best game makers and collaborators in the industry working with us. What's more, we're a fun bunch of game developers, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together. Our games are not for everyone. Are they for you?***
 We are now looking for a Backend Developer
   

  

 As a Backend Developer, you will play a key role in the design, development, and optimization of our backend systems. You will work closely with a collaborative team of developers and engineers, focusing on technologies such as C#, Microsoft Orleans, ASP.NET Core, Azure, and SQL Server. If you are passionate about building scalable and efficient backend solutions, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Who you are:**
* Proven experience in backend development using C# and ASP.NET Core.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Orleans or other actor model frameworks for distributed and scalable systems.
* Strong expertise in designing and optimizing database structures, preferably with SQL Server.
* Experience with cloud technologies, particularly Azure.
* Understanding of different backend architectural styles and best practices.
* Not required but beneficial if you have experience with Kubernetes and frontend development


**What you'll do:**
* Application Development: Design and develop backend solutions using C#, ASP.NET Core, and Microsoft Orleans, ensuring high performance, scalability, and maintainability.
* Cloud Integration: Utilize Azure services to build and optimize cloud-based backend components, ensuring seamless integration with our applications.
* Database Management: Design and implement efficient database structures using SQL Server, optimizing data storage, and retrieval for optimal system performance.
* Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure the successful delivery of projects.
* Third-party platforms: Build, monitor and maintain integrations with third party platforms.


**Our tech stack**
* NET/C#, Docker, Kubernetes/AKS, Azure, SQL Server, CosmosDB, Redis, Grafana, Angular, TypeScript


****How to apply****
 If you think that this position matches your background and skills, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your CV in English as soon as possible. We ask that your application always include relevant work samples or a link to your portfolio.
   

  

 We interview candidates continuously and hire when we find a good fit.
   

  

**Practical Information**
**Scope:** 
 Full-time: 40 hours per week with initial 6 month probation period.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Office first, hybrid solution possible. You need to be eligible to work in Sweden.
   

  

**We are a pet friendly office! You can expect to find dogs and occasionally some cats around.**
**What We Offer**
 Arrowhead Game Studios is a growing team of about 100+ people, best known for our co-op titles. Despite our size, we remain a friendly and down to earth bunch, who love to indulge in our passion for video games together.
   

  

 Located in a newly built, custom-tailored offices on the Hammarby Kaj waterfront, we enjoy everything Stockholm has to offer. A thriving game dev scene, along with all types of activities are immediately available on our doorstep.
   

  

 Our talented developers are crucial to our success, therefore we put a lot of emphasis in creating and maintaining a prosperous culture. We’re committed to open and transparent communication. Your ideas are welcomed, valued, appreciated - the ceiling for creative discussions is high.
   

  

 We also have numerous work benefits for all our employees. You can read about them here!

title: Product Developer to New Development (1 year temporary position)
description:
**Job Description**
*We are looking for a Product Developer Accessories & FBB with a strategic mindset, a passion for fashion, and a collaborative spirit to join our Guest Design & Collabs team at New Development, H&M.*
**What You’ll Do**
 As a Product Developer in Guest Design & Collabs, you’ll be at the heart of some of H&M’s most exciting and influential projects. This role gives you the unique opportunity to work with renowned guest designers and creative teams, shaping collections that capture global attention and set new standards for fashion innovation.  In this position you will focus on developing accessories, shoes and bags. In this fast-paced, collaborative environment, your vision and expertise will help turn bold concepts into reality, making a real impact on our brand and our customers.

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a Senior Software Engineer at Coody, you’ll be working on challenging and fun assignments for companies that you can be proud to have worked with. You’ll be a key player in designing and building scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, while also contributing to areas like working methods, product strategy, and maintaining a great team spirit.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to jump headfirst into new environments. We’re all about embracing new challenges as opportunities to grow, so if you thrive in a dynamic setting, this is the place for you. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re looking for Software Engineers with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:
   

  

* Experience building scalable software in cloud environments
* Expertise in at least one modern programming language like TypeScript, JavaScript, Java, .Net, Golang, Kotlin, Rust, Ruby, Erlang / Elixir, Python (you get the idea), and related frameworks
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or something related
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Join Us as a Senior Radio Software Developer – Antenna Calibration
   

  

 Help shape the future of 5G and 6G radio technology at Ericsson in Stockholm.
   

  

 As part of the Product Engineering Unit Radio within the Business Unit Networks, we leverage cutting-edge telecommunication technologies to deliver innovation at scale. Our vibrant workplace in Kista, Stockholm fosters continuous learning, creativity, and collaboration—and our impact resonates worldwide.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced software engineer with deep expertise in radio systems and antenna calibration to design, develop, and optimize world-class calibration solutions for our advanced Radio Units. If you have 5+ years of hands-on experience in antenna calibration and radio software development, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 In this role, you will be part of a highly skilled software team, working in close collaboration with specialists in software development, RF hardware, system engineering, and test engineering across the full product lifecycle. From concept and prototyping to integration, deployment, and ongoing maintenance, you’ll help deliver calibration solutions that ensure precise performance and enable exceptional beamforming capabilities.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Product development, from concept through deployment and support of released products.
* Implement and maintain antenna calibration solutions for MIMO radios.
* Drive automation in functional and performance testing (C++, Java, Python, MATLAB).
* Contribute to system architecture and software design for radio product lines outside Antenna calibration specific area
* Continuously improve product quality, processes, and development tools.


**The skills you bring:**
* 5+ years of experience in radio systems and antenna calibration.
* Strong C++ programming skills; proficiency in Java, Python, MATLAB.
* Proven experience of radio troubleshooting and software test automation.
* Solid understanding of MIMO & beamforming.
* BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English.


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience with calibration frameworks, VNAs, spectrum analyzers.
* Familiarity with 3GPP standards and 5G NR radio architectures.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

 772212

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.*
 At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.
   

  

 Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.
   

  

**What you’ll do**
 We’re currently looking for a Senior Software Developer to join our Digital HR & Finance team. In this role, you will report to the Digital Domain Manager and be part of a cross-functional digital team that ensures our Finance and HR functions have the modern digital capabilities they need to power a cutting-edge steel plant.
   

  

 You’ll take a leading role in shaping the digital backbone of our finance and HR functions. In this role, you will not only design and build highly decoupled microservices, APIs, and solution architectures, but also guide the team in agile ways of working to ensure delivery velocity and high-quality outcomes. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs, translate them into technical solutions, and ensure that what we deliver creates tangible value for the
   

  

 business while adhering to our digital principles. Together with your teammates, you will take responsibility for ensuring that data flows from across the organization are correct, reliable, and scalable.
   

  

 Your daily work will include, but is not limited to:
   

  

* Designing, developing, and operating fast, scalable, and reliable backend services
* Building infrastructure, deployment pipelines, and development tools that enable efficient and high-quality delivery
* Guide and coach the team in agile ways of working, acting as a Scrum Master when needed to help the team maintain focus, flow, and delivery
* Collaborating with HR and Finance stakeholders to translate needs into solid technical solutions
* Provide technical leadership in solution architecture, setting standards for microservice design, APIs, and data flows, and supporting
* Mentoring teammates and contributing to a culture of collaboration, learning, and continuous improvement


**What You’ll Bring**
 You’re enthusiastic and solutions-focused, with a genuine interest in connecting technology to real business value. You enjoy working in agile teams, supporting others, and finding smart ways to solve problems. You thrive in dynamic environments and bring curiosity and structure to your work, always with a growth mindset.
   

  

 Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below:
   

  

* A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field (or equivalent practical experience)
* Experience leading teams or acting as a Scrum Master or similar role
* Proficiency in backend development using Java, Kotlin, or similar languages
* Familiarity with engineering best practices such as continuous delivery, automated testing, and clean code
* Exposure to Kubernetes, Terraform, and event-driven architecture – though a willingness to learn is just as important
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate across both technical and non-technical teams


**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

 Here’s what makes this role unique:
   

  

* Breadth, not silos: You’ll work across multiple technical areas—backend, architecture, infrastructure, DevOps and Data—gaining deep understanding of our digital ecosystem.
* Ownership from day one: You’ll support a specific domain and act as a bridge between operations and tech, and drive solutions all the way from need to implementation and iteration.
* Close to the action: You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders, understand their workflows, and ensure your digital solutions create real value in their day-to-day operations.


**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: NodeJS & React Tech Lead
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a skilled Tech Lead to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Tech Lead for the Acquisition team, you will lead the development efforts for acquiring new customers to Qred. You will have a crucial role throughout the entire development lifecycle - from planning to execution. You will be an integral part of our team, taking on significant responsibilities while enjoying numerous opportunities for professional development. You will lead and inspire the Acquisition team, working fullstack, help shape our technology stack, influence the technical roadmap, and drive innovation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Be accountable for leading the architecture and vision of our applications, both backend and frontend.
* Maintain a good balance of code quality and developer experience, keeping up with the latest technologies that are out there and ensure our tech stack is always up to date.
* Provide guidance and mentor our developers to thrive to be the best of themselves through code reviews, pair programming and competence forums.
* Work closely with the product and engineering managers to create smooth, secure and high-performing user experiences in an agile manner.
* You will be a member of the tech team that includes all architects and tech leads across all engineering teams. Together, you will advance Qred's tech stack in line with the company's technical strategy.


**Preferred Experience**
* Several years of experience building and maintaining event web applications using React and event driven backend built upon node and serverless in AWS, with a good understanding of component-based architecture and state management and cloud.
* Believes the best way to have a clean code and architecture is to write tests and ensure security and performance in the implementation.
* Able to communicate with product managers about the feasibility of business requirements - both technical and design wise.
* Excited about leadership opportunities and enjoys sharing knowledge with the team and mentoring other developers
* Vibe coding experience from tools such as copilot agent, cursor, claude code, gemini-cli etc in combination with mcp.
* Experience within onboarding flows is highly preferred.


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based from our office in Stockholm (Drottninggatan 98). While we encourage a hybrid setup, we do expect you to be at least three days per week at the office. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. The start date is flexible, but the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

  

  

 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Hos oss på Modular Finance arbetar vi för att göra finansbranschen mer tillgänglig. Genom att bygga smarta, datadrivna verktyg skapar vi ökad transparens och effektivitet för över 8000 användare. Vi står inför en spännande expansion från Sverige vidare ut i Norden och Storbritannien, och söker därför en driven utvecklare till vårt team!
 



  





**Om oss** 




 Vi är ett stabilt, snabbväxande och entreprenöriellt SaaS-bolag inom finans med drygt 85 anställda. Det innebär en fartfylld miljö, där du får växa med ett stort ansvar och har stor frihet att forma din egen roll och utveckling. På Modular Finance motiveras vi av att skapa värde för våra kunder, av att se egna initiativ bli verklighet och av att arbeta i en miljö där vi ständigt lär oss nya saker. Nya kollegor får även möjlighet att köpa in sig i bolaget och vara med på vår fortsatta resa.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Vår breda produktportfölj innebär många intressanta utmaningar för dig som fullstack-utvecklare. Här får du möjlighet att bidra med dina kunskaper och utvecklas inom frontend, backend samt även DevOps.
 



  





 Dina ansvarsområden som utvecklare hos oss kommer bland annat vara att:
 



  




* Delta i utvecklingen av våra produkter från koncept till lansering
* Arbeta med både frontend, backend och infrastruktur för att skapa robusta och skalbara lösningar
* Samarbeta nära andra team-medlemmar för att identifiera och lösa tekniska utmaningar



  





 Några exempel på teknologier vi nyttjar och som du kan få möjlighet att arbeta med:
 



  




* Typescript, React, Angular
* Go, Java, Postgres, Rust
* Google Cloud Platform, Docker, Kubernetes



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig med en examen från en ingenjörsutbildning eller motsvarande, och gärna ett par års erfarenhet i branschen. Du vill bredda din kompetens och är nyfiken på att hitta nya tekniska lösningar på problem.
 



  





 Hos oss finns alltid tillfälle att testa egna idéer! För detta krävs därför ett visst mått av självständighet, vilket vi ser är meriterande att kunna visa i en intervjuprocess. Med det sagt så jobbar vi förstås främst tillsammans när vi löser problem. Utöver rena tekniska kvalifikationer värdesätter vi även intresse för och kunskap om börsen. Det blir både bättre och roligare ju mer domänkunskap våra anställda har, även på utvecklingsavdelningen.
 



  





 Andra meriterande erfarenheter är:
 



  




* App-utveckling, t.ex React Native
* Linux, Bash eller annan shellscripting
* Docker, Kubernetes
* Utveckling i cloud-miljö - GCP, AWS, Azure eller liknande
* Egna projekt, så länka gärna din Github!



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 



* En kultur som främjar lärande och kunskapsspridning inom vårt område
* En snabbt växande arbetsplats med goda möjligheter till spännande utveckling inom bolaget
* Ett stabilt bolag med konkurrenskraftig lön, delägarskap, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukförsäkring och vårdförsäkring
* Stark teamkänsla och gemensamma bolagsaktiviteter, såsom AW:s och större events



  





**Anställningsform:** 
 Tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om 6 månader
 



  





**Startdatum:** 
 Så snart som möjligt.
 



  





**Placering:** 
 På vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Vi tillämpar en hybridmodell med 8 valfria remotedagar i månaden.
 



  





**Är det du? Ansök nu!** 




 Du är varmt välkommen med din ansökan. Urvalet kommer att ske löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan. Vid frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Jacob Schoerner, Tech Lead, på jacob.schoerner@modularfinance.se.
 



  





 Vi kommer att svara på alla ansökningar.

title: Data Scientist in Business & Retail Banking at SEB
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
 Are you an experienced Data Scientist who wants to create value through data and innovation and is motivated by delivering customer value with high quality? Do you have a proactive attitude when it comes to continuous improvements and investigating new technologies and concepts, and at the same time have experience of building AI models/systems? If so, this is probably a position for you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Data Scientist, your role is crucial in driving the work of AI and Advanced Analytics across the BRB organization and its stakeholders. This role will focus on enhancing, validating, and maintaining Customer Due Diligence (CDD) models within the scope of the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) directive as well as other models delivering insights to key stakeholders. Collaboration, clear communication to technical/non- technical audience and technical expertise are essential in this role.
   

  

 The Business & Retail Banking division is now strengthening Data Analytics & CIO Office further to accelerate the journey towards becoming the #1 full-service digital retail bank in the Swedish market. We are a team of around 35 highly engaged and skillful data and analytics professionals, and we are now seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist that can work as a quantitative model developer to join our AI Analytics team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Analyze, Interpret and participate in maintaining and developing of models based on complex data: Define and analyze complex data- business related problems, propose well-structured solutions and drive the work/process from inception to completion.
* Design and be part of developing AI Models/Systems and Architectures: Ensure models represent business concepts, compliance and requirements, adhere to industry best practices, and support monitoring, governance, and quality initiatives.
* Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Collaborating with business stakeholders, IT teams, and other cross-functional teams.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have**
 You have a very good understanding of data & (AI) analytics/data science frameworks and how to implement it in an efficient way to an organization that is heading into a predominantly Cloud based environment. You are committed to providing high-level service and are a true team player with a strong ability to build relationships with colleagues. You are prestige less and driven with a can-do attitude. You have a documented track record in working with data, analytics and AI and know what is required to truly leverage it.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Experience in working in Cloud environment, and plus if GCP stack (VertexAI, BigQuery, Looker, GitLab, Jupyter)
* Proficiency in Python (or Scala, Rust, C++, Go, Julia,R)
* Plus if you are familiar with GenAI tools, frameworks, and best practices.
* Strong knowledge of model monitoring techniques, performance metrics, and model validation methodologies
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to understand complex business requirements.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Having worked in an agile setup.


**What We Offer**
* We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-lifebalance.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
* Innovative company in forefront of technology.


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB and our team. Since we meet candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than
 **2025-10-10** 
 . In case of uncertainty or if you have questions about the position, please, contact Hiu Yee Fan, hiu-yee.fan@seb.se
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.
