title: Head of Digital Operations and Infrastr
description:
**Join our Team**
**About This Opportunity**
 We are seeking a strategic and hands-on leader to serve as Head of People Infrastructure & Operations, responsible for the delivery, operations, and continuous improvement of our people technology platforms. This role ensures that our HR systems - particularly SAP SuccessFactors and related data infrastructure - are aligned with business needs, scalable, and future-ready.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Own the delivery and operations of core people platforms, including SuccessFactors, and related third-party HR technologies.
* Lead the configuration, architecture, and platform enablement efforts to ensure our technology landscape supports workforce strategy and business growth.
* Partner closely with SAP SuccessFactors to influence and align their product roadmap with our organizational needs.
* Enable the development of HR applications on top of our platforms by working in close collaboration with product managers, internal IT, external development partners, and UX teams.
* Oversee demand planning and governance of all application development and customization initiatives stemming from product and business roadmaps.
* Ensure data quality, compliance, and governance, supporting enterprise-wide data integrity and readiness for advanced analytics and AI use cases.
* Embed AI-readiness by preparing infrastructure, data models, and operational processes to support intelligent automation and augmentation across the HR function. Act as a key bridge between technical teams, vendors, and HR leadership, translating strategic goals into operational execution.


**How We Measure Success**
* Significant improvements in user experience, with SuccessFactors as the primary focus, followed by other people platforms.
* Seamless implementation of major HR applications on SuccessFactors, enabled through structured collaboration with our internal and external partners.
* Effective integration of third-party tools and software into the broader HR technology ecosystem.
* Rapid deployment of enterprise-grade AI use cases, both within HR-specific (vertical) and cross-functional (horizontal) platforms.


**The Skills You Bring**
* Proven leadership in HR technology delivery, ideally within large enterprise environments.
* Deep familiarity with SAP SuccessFactors and experience managing its configuration, integration, and roadmap alignment.
* Strong understanding of HR data architecture, application development, and agile delivery methods.
* Experience in managing cross-functional teams across IT, vendor ecosystems, and business functions.
* Hands-on management style, capable of both setting direction and supporting execution across multiple workstreams.
* Strategic mindset with operational discipline—able to anticipate platform needs and act as a key enabler of scalable, high-impact solutions.


 This is a unique opportunity to shape the technological backbone of our people function and to directly enable the next generation of digital HR capabilities, including the responsible use of AI.
   

  

**Application**
 We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV/resume in English.
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 17th of October 2025. We will review applications prior to the closing date and conduct interviews in parallel with the application process. Therefore, you are welcome to express your interest as soon as you see the job ad.
   

  

**Location** 
 : Based in Kista, Stockholm Sweden or Reading, UK.
   

  

**Work setup:** 
 We aim for approximately 60% on-site presence at our office.
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept or process applications submitted via email.
   

  

 If you have specific questions about the role, feel free to contact:
   

  

 Nina Juthage, Principal Talent Acquisition Partner, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com
   

  

 Please be aware that this position, will be subject to a comprehensive background check and vetting process.
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 774106

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI** 




 As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role to design, build and maintain machine learning models for all our business areas. You will work on problems where you will get to utilize your skills in such interrelated disciplines as machine learning, software engineering, data science, data engineering as well as prompt and AI/API engineering. In the end, you will drive and contribute to solutions of some of our key problems around vehicle availability, reliability & safety, user experience personalisation and parking. You will primarily be working in a team focused on predicting the future demand for our vehicles. Specifically where and when they will be needed. Further, you will have a big impact on anticipating and acting early on a vehicle’s maintenance needs, which plays a key role in the good user riding experience.
 



 Your responsibilities will include:
 


* As an embedded member of a cross-functional product team, you will be responsible for end-to-end machine learning and AI projects. This includes everything from identifying business problems and formulating solution hypotheses, to defining data requirements, prototyping, implementing solutions in production, and measuring their business impact.
* Maintain and improve Voi's machine learning platform to ensure our machine learning products adhere to state-of-the-art MLOps standards, with support from the team
* Work with colleagues to improve team processes and support mutual learning and knowledge sharing



**WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK** 




 We’re looking for a Machine Learning professional with experience from working in a fast-paced environment. In addition to being fluent in English, we believe the right person has:
 


* Higher education in one of the mathematical sciences such as computer science, mathematics, physics, bioinformatics or with a similar, data centric, degree
* A strong business sense with laser focus on business value and user impact
* Fluency in Python and software engineering in general
* Documented experience in developing production-quality software
* Experience of working with real-time inference and/or MLOps in one of the major cloud environments
* Experience of working on edge machine learning and computer vision is a bonus
* Hands-on contribution to managing projects from start to finish – from tackling business challenges to planning, building, launching, and keeping an eye on the results.



**WHY VOI?** 




 Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:
 


* Join Europe's #1 micromobility company
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation and a scalable ML function
* Enjoy unlimited free Voi ride
* Voi is a multicultural company with employees from all over the world, which is something we value deeply. With a flexible public holiday policy, you have the opportunity to choose which holidays, religious or cultural, you want to celebrate
* We do hackdays and lab days to inspire growth and explore new solutions to problems. We hope to see creative ideas to tackle hard problems that you find important to solve with colleagues outside your inner team.
* While everyone is encouraged to meet their colleagues at the office, we do have a hybrid setup when it comes to remote work in order to find the optimal work-life-balance.
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution

title: iOS-utvecklare
description:
**iOS.utvecklare till Bokus Play** 




  





***Vill du följa med på vår resa? Målet är att fortsätta bygga nya digitala boktjänster. Vill du följa med och ta hjälp av ny och utmanande teknik på vägen mot nya spännande användarupplevelser?***




  





 Bokusgruppen är på en digital och teknisk resa under varumärkena Akademibokhandeln, Bokus och Bokus Play. Ambitionen är att bygga nya digitala erbjudanden och boktjänster som kommer fortsätta förändra hur vi läser böcker. Vi söker nu en iOS-utvecklare till våra produkter Bokus Play och Bokus Reader. Målet är att tillsammans med modern teknik uppnå nya spännande användarupplevelser.
 



  





 Bokus Play är svaret på den växande streamingmarknaden för ljudböcker. Tjänsten är flexibel, prisvärd och erbjuder enkla och unika abonnemang för alla som lyssnar på ljudböcker. Bokus Reader är vår app för att konsumera digital styckesköpt litteratur.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som iOS-utvecklare kommer du att ta ägandeskap för app-utvecklingen för iOS. Det finns stora visioner om hur den skall vidareutvecklas och du har en stor möjlighet att styra din egen och teamets väg framåt.
 



  





 Du kommer vara en del i Bokus Plays app-team och kommer att arbeta i ett tvärfunktionellt team som består av iOS-, Android- och backend-utvecklare, UX-designer och testare. Tillsammans kommer ni att skapa den bästa användarupplevelsen för Bokus Plays användare och på så sätt bidra till kunskap, glädje och inspiration.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som gillar att skriva kod i Swift och har erfarenhet av SwiftUI. Du hittar nya vägar för att lösa problem och tar ägandeskap för apputvecklingen. För att trivas och lyckas i rollen behöver du vara en fena på att jobba med teknik som utmanar samt att du brinner för att lära dig nya saker och söker rätt information för att få saker att hända.
 



  





**Vi tror att du** 



* Har erfarenhet av att utveckla samt lansera appar för iOS, iPadOS.
* Har omfattande erfarenhet av att arbeta med Swift, Structured Concurrency
* Älskar att göra det lilla extra för att göra apparna tillgängliga för alla.
* Har ett intresse för testdriven utveckling
* Gillar teamarbete och agil metodologi



  





 Som person tror vi att du är nyfiken, positiv, social och engagerad.
 



  





**Vad får dig att trivas?** 




 Vi erbjuder en stark företagskultur och många engagerade och kunniga kollegor. Du har din bas antingen på det moderna kontoret på Kungsholmen i Stockholm tillsammans med knappt 100 kollegor eller på vårt kontor i centrala Malmö där flera medarbetare på IT-avdelningen utgår ifrån.
 



  





**Rekryteringsprocessen** 




 Välkommen med din ansökan, intervjuer kommer ske löpande.
 



  





 Bakgrundskontroll görs på slutkandidaten.
 



  





*Bokusgruppen är Sveriges marknadsledande bokhandelsaktör som med de starka och kompletterande varumärkena Akademibokhandeln, Bokus, Bokus Play och når en mycket stor andel av Sveriges befolkning. Förutom böcker i alla kanaler och format erbjuds ett stort och inspirerande övrigt sortiment. Bokusgruppen ska möta kundernas varierande behov och vara förstahandsvalet för så många som möjligt. Med en stark företagskultur och engagerade medarbetare jobbar vi alla mot samma vision – läsglädje för alla, varje dag.* 




  





*Bokusgruppen äger Bokhandelsgruppen (med varumärket Akademibokhandeln) och Bokus (med varumärkena Bokus och Bokus Play). Bokusgruppen har cirka 430 anställda på kontor och i butik, huvudkontor i Stockholm samt kontor i Malmö och Göteborg. Den årliga omsättningen är cirka 2 miljarder. Bokusgruppen är sedan 4 juni 2021 noterat på Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market. Mer information se
 
 www.bokusgruppen.com*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson are technology leaders that create ground-breaking technology, conceived, built and delivered to make people’s lives easier, more fulfilling and connected. To imagine the possible and work with the latest technology of today and tomorrow, we are looking for the next generation in Tech.
   

  

 We are on a mission to ensure Ericsson is making the best use of data as possible. Right now, we're seeking a newly graduated Data Engineer to continue our exciting journey ahead.
   

  

 You will be a part of the Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence team in the Production system for our Radio Unit Software sector. Our mission is to enable our production applications with data and AI. We empower people and machines with insights based on large amounts of data from development environments, labs, and Ericsson products in live customer’s networks.
   

  

 The area of data and AI is constantly evolving, and you will be working with pioneering commercial and open source tools to accomplish our mission.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 As a Data Engineer you will join a group of skilled software engineers, data engineers and data scientists. You will have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Work in a team to enable usage of data within Ericsson.
* Ensure that the data is securely ingested to the data lake.
* Prepare, transform, enrich, and improve quality of the data to make it available for consumption.
* Create our data Platform, to ensure that we have data with high quality and high availability.
* Work closely with data consumers and make sure that their specific data needs are met.
* Provide valuable and concrete insights using data and/or graphical user interfaces.


**The skills you bring:**
 Your personal qualities are important for us, and we believe you are curious, innovative, collaborative, and have an eagerness to learn new technologies. As part of NextGen we are seeking for 1 new colleague who wish to explore their career with us, and who is newly graduated or have a maximum 2-3 years of relevant experience.
   

  

 In addition, we believe you have:
   

  

* A BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or equivalent.
* Passion for data engineering, problem-solving, and data analytics.
* Knowledge of Python.
* Understanding of containerization and infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes, Linux.
* Exposure to message buses (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
* Familiarity with data storages/databases (ElasticSearch/OpenSearch, S3, MongoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL).
* Experience with development tools (Gitlab, Gerrit, Jira).
* Basic knowledge of observability tools (Grafana, Kibana, OpenTelemetry).
* Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
* It is considered a plus if you have experience with workflow orchestration tools (Airflow, Argo, Jenkins), big data technologies, and cloud platforms like AWS.
* It is also a merit if you have knowledge of frontend development (Node.js, React.js), IT security, and UX/UI best practices.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Mobile Developer - Android/iOS & Hybrid
description:
Why This Job Is for You
   

  

 You want to be part of an engaged and collaborative team where you can deepen your expertise in software engineering, with focus on mobile apps, while continuing to grow your technical knowledge. You enjoy contributing to meaningful product development for small to big product companies, and public organizations alike.
   

  

 At DDX we put people at the heart of our process. We create digital products that improve everyday life — not just for today’s users, but for future generations, with a lasting impact on both people and the planet. We choose the right tech for the task - Android, iOS, or modern multiplatform frameworks like React Native and Kotlin Multiplatform. We value your curiosity and willingness to explore new technologies.
   

  

 You will be working within our Hardware & Design business area, where we combine broad engineering expertise with deep specialist knowledge and a user-centered approach – to develop physical products and digital experiences all the way from concept to large-scale production.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain digital products, primarily mobile apps for Android and/or iOS. Collaborate closely with designers and backend developers to craft seamless, user-friendly solutions.
* Work with CI/CD pipelines to ensure continuous integration and high-quality delivery. Participate in architectural discussions and influence tech decisions and design patterns.
* Evaluate and implement new technologies and frameworks to enhance the development process and user experience.
* Contribute to a collaborative, knowledge-sharing culture. Help guide our clients by understanding their goals and suggesting solutions that create real value for them—and us.


**Qualifications**
* 4+ years of hands-on experience in mobile development, either native (Android/iOS) or with hybrid frameworks such as React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform, or Flutter.
* Experience with setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
* Solid understanding of architecture, technology choices, and design patterns in early-stage projects.
* Strong communication skills and a team-first mindset. Bonus if you have experience on cross-functional teamwork, with strong product focus in close collaboration with designers and product people.
* On top of apps, if you been all over the tech stack, with experience in web technologies for both frontend and backend it stands out.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.


 An Exciting Journey with Knightec Group
   

  

 DDX is part of Knightec Group. Together, we form Northern Europe's leading strategic partner in product and digital service development. Combining cross-functional expertise with a holistic business understanding, we help our clients transform strategies into impactful solutions.
   

  

 Joining us means working in an environment where collaboration, creativity, and curiosity thrive. We believe that innovation happens when different perspectives meet — and we live by that every day.
   

  

 Practical Information
   

  

 This is a permanent position with a six-month probationary period. You’ll be based in our central Stockholm office, but we support hybrid and flexible work arrangements. The ideal start date is as soon as possible, or by agreement. Apply no later than 2025-11-17. If you have questions about the role, contact Mikael Westh, Talent Acquisition Specialist. Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We’re looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Product Design Lead – Consumer Facing(Bangkok - Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**This role is BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED.**
**Getting to know our Agoda Design Team**
 Embark on a journey with the Agoda Design Team, a vibrant community of product designers crafting innovative solutions from the heart of Bangkok, Thailand, and Gurugram, India. As a pivotal force in our product-driven company, we collaborate closely with product managers and engineers to unravel customer challenges, shaping workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. Whether you’re honing your craft, expanding your skillset, or stepping into a leadership role, now is the time to join a team that’s both scrappy and hands-on yet influential enough to drive change and shape product strategy. Be a part of Agoda’s Design team and contribute to unlocking the world for our global community of travelers.
   

  

**About Our Consumer Facing Team**
 Our Consumer Facing Design Team is at the forefront of creating exceptional travel experiences across Hotel Accommodations, Homes, Reviews, Content & Localization. We’re on a mission to craft a cutting-edge booking platform prioritizing choice, value, user-friendliness, and personalization for our customers booking across our platform.
   

  

**The Product Design Lead, Consumer Facing at Agoda is responsible for:**
 As the Design Lead for our Consumer-Facing Products, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping and executing the vision for accommodation funnels that directly engage our customers. Through your design leadership and strategic insights, you'll collaborate closely with product stakeholders to deliver seamless experiences. Your primary responsibility will be to guide and inspire a team of designers, fostering an environment where innovative solutions thrive. Together, we'll streamline the booking process on Agoda, ensuring users can easily find and book their accommodations.
   

  

 In this role, you'll strike a delicate balance between user-centric design and business objectives. You'll empower your team to advocate for the user while aligning their efforts with our overarching business goals and KPIs. Your influence will extend beyond the design realm as you champion the user and business needs, driving forward industry-leading UX solutions for our accommodation products at Agoda.
   

  

 Join us in creating experiences that redefine the standard for consumer engagement and satisfaction in the travel industry.
   

  

**Day to day, it looks like:**
* Manage scope of work for your team, and you determine how to divide work amongst designers.
* Leading design strategy for complex initiatives and growing design leaders
* Driving design vs business objectives and measurement alignment on core product initiatives that design team or product team drives
* You ensure successful execution by your team. You surface and address questions, bottlenecks, dependencies, and conflicts as they arise, working with stakeholders when needed. You ensure high quality design decisions are made.
* You maintain and apply a process for effective design.
* You take steps to build a healthy, high performing, capability-complete team. You hire designers to fill open headcount. You foster a positive culture on your team.
* You coach and mentor your direct reports to make sure they hone their competencies and grow in their careers.
* Leading projects and groups to define and sell a coherent medium to long term vision, with milestones and short term actions to get there. Is building the design organization as a focus for wider company vision and strategy.
* You represent your team upwards to your manager: you ensure the team's priorities are well understood, you advocate for them, and you flag any underperformers, stakeholder misalignments, or other challenges they face.
* Partnering with a design leadership team to help shape management practices, and mentoring other design leaders to put those in practice


**Product Design Lead at Agoda means you have a track record of** 
 :
   

  

* Leading design strategy for complex initiatives and growing design leaders
* Leading through ambiguity, making use of your soft skills to persuade and build alignment with senior leaders around a vision and approach
* Using holistic thinking to identify customer experience opportunities that create impact across the organization
* Partnering with a design leadership team to help shape management practices, and mentoring other design leaders to put those in practice
* Incorporating advancements in the field of product design to guide the skills and practices of our team
* Developing a deep understanding of current native technologies and design patterns, and can guide your design team to use these in practice


**Qualities we value in design leaders:**
* Effective articulation of ideas and design solutions
* Expressing feedback with kindness and candor
* Tolerance for ambiguity and healthy curiosity
* Translation of quantitative & qualitative insights into design decisions
* Contribution to our culture: motivation, optimism, quality, integrity


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
* LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/agoda
* YouTube https://www.youtube.com/agodalife


**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Senior Product Manager (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to know our team:**
 In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Product Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.
   

  

 Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda Product Managers work closely with executive leadership and have high visibility among the C-suite; they have direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy. Product puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 This role is
 **BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED.** 
 Our Senior Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers. As our next Senior Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with senior leadership cross-functionally to define, build, and deliver the best travel solutions.
   

  

 You will get dedicated engineering resources that you, and only you define and allocate. We expect you to have a hands-on mentality and spend considerable time with your SCRUM teams, have enthusiasm to develop engineered processes and technologies and apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements. Product Managers can modify \*every\* system we have in our company to suit their needs.
   

  

 By applying to this role, you'll be considered for a role either in User Experience, Marketing, Finance or Supply product vertical. The goal is to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, competencies, and where you will have the most impact. We’re looking for Senior Product Managers for every part of our business. Our entire Product team sits in Bangkok. This is an Individual Contributor position.
   

  

**In this role, you'll get to:**
* Analyze the online travel ecosystem, markets, competitive landscape and user requirements.
* Conceptualize, launch and optimize products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly.
* Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal and UX teams on cutting-edge technologies.
* Develop innovative solutions to some of the world’s difficult problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions.


**What you'll need to succeed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in technical field (i.e. Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline).
* Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to inform and influence decision-making
* Strong data skills
* Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with proven ability to convey complex messages clearly and with conviction to different stakeholders
* Experience developing and launching products
* Experience leading global product vision, go-to-market strategy and design discussions.
* Entrepreneurial and analytical skills; effective at breaking down complex problems and driving and managing change
* Hands-on mentality


**It's great if you have:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics
* Data tools - SQL, Python, R, or equivalent

title: Staff Engineer - Authentication
description:
**Build something monumental for Healthcare!**
 At Tandem Health we’re reimagining healthcare by putting clinicians first. Our platform - designed by clinicians, for clinicians - is built on deep insight into real-world pain points, with intuitive medical notes and workflows that truly support patient care.
   

  

 We’re a fast-scaling health-tech company backed by top investors and expanding globally. We move fast, stay curious, and believe building something that matters starts with an extraordinary team. If you're passionate about impact and innovation, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**About The Role & You**
 You’re a deeply curious person and that curiosity has led you deep into the world of authentication and identity. You care profoundly about how people prove who they are on the internet, how systems decide who gets access to what, and how we can make those decisions seamlessly and securely.
   

  

 Over the years, you’ve worked with a wide variety of authentication methods, identity frameworks, and security standards. You’ve seen the tradeoffs of different approaches firsthand and learned how to design systems that balance security, usability, and scalability. At your previous companies, people came to you when they wanted to understand how authentication
 *actually* 
 works under the hood.
   

  

 At Tandem, you’ll lead the effort to build secure, robust, and user-friendly authentication systems that power the next generation of healthcare products. You’ll define the technical direction, set standards, and design core identity infrastructure - enabling safe, seamless access for clinicians and patients across all European countries.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you’ll shape both the product and our engineering culture. If you’re excited by the challenge of building authentication systems that people can trust and doing it at the scale and safety level healthcare demands we’d love to meet you.
   

  

 What You Will Do
   

  

* Lead the design and development of our authentication and identity systems - from foundational protocols to user-facing access flows that are critical to clinician and patient trust.
* Define and implement robust authorization frameworks, ensuring users only access the data and functionality they are entitled to, while keeping the experience seamless.
* Evaluate and integrate industry standards and authentication technologies, understanding the tradeoffs to select the right approach for each use case.
* Build systems that scale securely, enabling safe and reliable identity management as our products grow to support healthcare organizations and their preferred Identity Providers across Europe..
* Serve as the go-to expert on authentication, helping others understand how identity systems work under the hood and driving best practices across the company.
* Set the technical direction for our identity and security efforts, mentoring engineers and fostering a culture of security, reliability, and technical excellence.


 What You Bring
   

  

* A proven track record of designing and implementing secure authentication and authorization systems in production environments.
* Deep experience with industry standards and identity frameworks (e.g. OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML, or similar) and a clear understanding of their tradeoffs.
* The ability to build systems that remain secure, performant, and reliable at scale, including rolling out authentication stacks to large user bases.
* A passion for digital identity and a deep curiosity for how systems work under the hood, you want to understand, not just use, the technology.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate closely with engineering, product, and security stakeholders across the organization.
* A bias toward ownership, proactivity, and collaboration, you take responsibility for outcomes and raise the bar for everyone around you.


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Strong experience building SSO integrations across diverse providers, and a clear vision for how to unify identity across multiple countries and healthcare partners.
* Prior work in healthcare tech or regulated environments.
* Deep understanding of clinical workflows, EHR systems, and medical documentation processes.


 Location
   

  

 We believe the best ideas happen when we’re together. This role is based in our vibrant HQ in the Epicenter building in the heart of Stockholm where you will work primarily from our office to collaborate, connect, and build our culture.
   

  

 How to Apply
   

  

 We adopt a continuous selection process, so please make sure to apply with your CV in English.
   

  

 Our interview process consists of 4 stages:
   

  

* Screening interview with Talent Acquisition
* Shorter technical interview with one of senior engineers
* Follow up technical interview with some of our Engineering team
* First interview with our CTO & Co-Founder
* Working Day - Join us in the Stockholm office for a day to experience our culture firsthand, collaborate with our team, and see how you work in action.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & company stock options
* 25 days/year of paid vacation
* 5,000 SEK wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag)
* Social and team-building activities (off-sites, after works, winter/summer parties)
* An opportunity to make a real positive impact in the world of healthcare
* Work with some of the best minds in AI, healthcare, and engineering.


*We review our benefits packages on a regular basis and might modify our benefits from time to time.*
**Culture at Tandem**
 At Tandem, we move fast, think big, and take ownership. We're a high-performing, diverse team with a shared drive to change the future of healthcare - and we’re just getting started.
   

  

 Our culture is built on action, ambition, and learning. You'll be trusted to take the lead, challenge yourself, and make an impact from day one. We believe real growth happens when you're stretched, supported, and surrounded by smart, passionate teammates who want to win together.
   

  

 Even though we’re spread across countries, we come together often in Sweden for team meetings, social events, and offsites - blending global reach with real human connection.
   

  

 We hire for talent, potential, and attitude - valuing different backgrounds and fresh perspectives. Great ideas come from everywhere, and we’re building a team that reflects the world we want to change.

title: Principal Product Manager (Bangkok-based)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to know our team:**
 In Product, ideas come alive. The world is moving fast so our culture empowers ownership and minimal bureaucracy. That’s the environment that enables you to do what you think is right – and quickly. Our Product Managers move fast, fail, learn, and pivot.
   

  

 Being a product-centric organization, our team works cross-functionally to build products from conception to launch by bringing together engineering and business worlds. Agoda Product Managers work closely with executive leadership and have high visibility among the C-suite; they have direct impact on Agoda’s growth and strategy. Product puts our travelers first and delivers that special travel experience in the most creative expression.
   

  

**The opportunity:**
 This role is
 **Bangkok-based** 
**, Relocation Provided.** 
 Principal Product Managers are analytical and data-driven individuals, who’re responsible for building products end-to-end focusing on analyzing and experimenting until our solutions are perfectly tailored to our travelers. As our next Principal Product Manager, you will drive product strategy and partner closely with senior leadership cross-functionally to define, build, and deliver the best travel solutions.
   

  

 You will get dedicated engineering resources that you, and only you define and allocate. We expect you to have a hands-on mentality and spend considerable time with your SCRUM teams, have enthusiasm to develop engineered processes and technologies and apply innovative solutions to make organizational improvements. You can modify \*every\* system we have in our company to suit their needs.
   

  

 By applying to this role, you'll be considered for a role either in User Experience, Marketing, Finance or Supply product vertical. The goal is to match you with the team that best aligns with your interests, competencies, and where you will have the most impact. We’re looking for Product Leaders for every part of our business. Our entire Product team sits in Bangkok.

* Analyze the online travel ecosystem, markets, competitive landscape and user requirements.
* Conceptualize, launch and optimize products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly.
* Work collaboratively with Engineering, Marketing, Legal and UX teams on cutting-edge technologies.
* Develop innovative solutions to some of the world’s difficult problems by collaborating as needed across regions, product areas, and functions.


**What you'll need to succeed:**
* 8+ years of Product Management experience
* Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to inform and influence decision-making
* Strong data skills

title: Senior Quantitative User Experience Researcher (Frontend) (Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**We have only scratched the surface.** 
 The online travel industry is an extremely dynamic and competitive space. We aim to deliver compelling designs that create a world-class customer experience. You will have a key role in defining the future of our products that reach millions of customers. Despite our size, we operate in a startup-like environment.
   

  

**Work in the heart of Asia.** 
 This is an amazing opportunity if you're looking for an exciting adventure abroad while expanding your international research capabilities. You get a chance to live in one of the most beautiful and most visited cities in the world!
   

  

**This position is open to worldwide candidates and we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Bangkok.**
 Senior UX Researchers have the breadth and depth of research method skills applicable to a wide range of questions, and over time develop standout areas of research excellence. A long track record and documented success in both research itself and achieving organizational impact is characteristic of Senior UX Researchers. The ability to integrate research into the work of colleagues in other roles makes the Senior UX Researcher effective and helps him/her achieve out-sized impact from research efforts. This ability, along with others that turn research into a strategic asset for Agoda's decisions and processes, comes from a maturity in overall research approach emphasizing the highest benefit from all research investments.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Masters Degree or PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Information Science, Psychology, Social Science, or any related field.
* 10+ years of relevant experience in consumer-facing business domains.
* Expert in Quantitative research. (Log analysis, internal metrics triangulation, survey design, response effects, sampling, crosstabs, and statistical concepts, etc.)
* But, also has experience with Qualitative and user-centered design methods (individual and group interviews, diary studies, direct observation, think-aloud usability testing, etc.)
* Comfortable with planning, scoping, conducting, analyzing and communicating research.
* Experience in evaluating, negotiating, and working with external research vendors.
* Be able to describe user problems and business opportunities to a variety of stakeholders by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative data.
* Ability to demonstrate critical thinking beyond business requests.
* Is a great storyteller and communicator, able to speak fluently to business people, product teams, designers, engineers, and other stakeholders. (in English)
* Enjoys collaborative work in a dynamic, data-driven, and creative environment.


**Responsibilities:**
 General Role Expectations:
   

  

* Conducts research end-to-end for high impact, leading stakeholders to the best collaboration with research for their goals.
* Initiates research efforts serving Product Vertical goals in the medium- and long-term given a well-informed understanding of the business.
* Formulates programmes of study and cumulative knowledge sharing relevant to the strategic objectives of their teams.
* Leads projects that are collaborations with other stakeholders.
* Accounts for the pros and cons of various research methodologies, and mentors others the use of techniques and tools for high-quality execution.


 Research Skills:
   

  

* Expertise at evaluating research opportunities, particularly with ambiguous requests e.g. importance, urgency, and impact.
* Ability to manage, challenge and shape inbound research requests, and propose solid research projects or programs.
* Excellent project execution, while exploring alternate methods, mixed methods and innovative approaches.
* Deep understands of the pros and cons of quantitative and qualitative research - and use of this knowledge to direct projects to appropriate methods.
* Deep expertise in at least one domain (eg. Pricing), a user type (eg. Business traveler) or a method (eg. Diary Study), being the "go-to person" on the research team for this.
* Triangulation of findings, methods, and theories within a project to ensure reliability and depth of insight.
* Ability to maximize the value and efficiency of research by applying secondary research and expert inspection methods.
* Solid knowledge of various software tools common in the field (e.g. for surveys, diary studies, analysis), and ability to apply the right tool to the problem.
* Solid knowledge of GDPR, data compliance and ethics that is present in all of their activities.


 Communication & Collaboration:
   

  

* Drives cross discipline/department collaboration via research insights/activities.
* Collaborates efficiently with other researchers and other disciplines with clear commitment to shared ownership.
* Shows excellent communication skills; tailored communication style for different audiences, concise and to the point, open to take input and feedback.
* Contributes to the communication and implementation of agreed standards of research excellence across the organization.

title: Fullstack Developer (Node.js, React, AWS)
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a Fullstack Developer to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack developer at Qred, you’ll be a part of a cross-functional team together with fellow Qredsters from diverse technical backgrounds. Our teams are carefully structured to promote collaboration and accountability, bringing together developers and UX designers to efficiently solve daily challenges and take ownership of the products we build. This team consist of four other developers, is well-structured and led by an Engineering Manager, Product Manager and Tech Lead, ensuring that everyone is included, aligned and moving in the same direction.
   

  

 We trust in our developer’s capability of implementing, testing, reviewing, deploying daily and operating their software in production.
   

  

**Requirements**
* At least a few years of experience in writing, releasing and maintaining web applications as well as integrations, using the following techs: Node.js, React and Amazon Web Services
* A flexible, positive mindset and a strong team spirit


**What Will Make You Stand Out**
* Familiarity with CloudFormation or CDK
* Hands-on knowledge of CI/CD tools such as Circle-ci, GitHub actions or similar
* Experience with the fintech industry


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

  

  

 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Produktutvecklare
description:
**Din roll hos oss**
--------------------


Vi söker nu en produktutvecklare till funktionen Produktägande fastighetsinformation. Om du gillar att arbeta med produktförändringar, att säkerställa att förändringarna genomförs strukturerat och att ha flera parallella arbetsuppgifter igång samtidigt är detta jobbet för dig.


Vår information tillhandahålls främst via tjänster med maskingränssnitt men också via e-tjänster med användargränssnitt. Tjänsterna används av företag, myndigheter och privatpersoner. Arbetet med systemförvaltning och produktutveckling sker integrerat och i nära samarbete med motsvarande funktion för geografisk information.


Som produktutvecklare kommer du arbeta med produkter och system med utgångspunkt i de som innehåller fastighetsinformation (till exempel fastighet, samfällighet, gemensamhetsanläggning, planer, rättigheter, samfällighetsförening, byggnad, adress, lägenhet, inskrivning och taxering).


Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat bestå av att:

* delta i och driva arbetet med produktförändringar, tillsammans med andra sakkunniga eller i projektform
* analysera önskemål om och behov av förändring som grund för verksamhetsbeslut. Du kommer ofta att vara den som är ansvarig för ärenden under såväl utredningsfasen som själva genomförandet, inklusive att dokumentera beslutade förändringar i beskrivande dokumentation (till exempel informationstillhandahållandemodeller i UML), och på webb
* testa produkter som innehåller fastighetsinformation i XML-format, verifiera att informationen levereras enligt krav, jämföra leveranser för att kontrollera hantering av informationsförändringar och dokumentera testresultat
* bidra i systemförvaltning och i samarbete med IT säkerställa att systemen fungerar enligt verksamhetens krav
* besvara detaljerade frågor i andra linjens support
* göra kundspecifika utsökningar ur databas för fastighetsprisinformation (SQL-uttag)
* analysera återkommande frågeställningar för att hitta åtgärder och genomföra förbättringar som gör att behovet av användarstöd minimeras
* medverka vid upprättande av förvaltningsplan med önskemål, krav samt resursbehov
* vara stöd till produktchefen i olika frågeställningar kopplade till produkter


I ditt arbete kommer du att ingå i olika nätverk, team och processer. Din naturliga hemvist kommer att vara som medlem i produktområdesteam för fastighetsinformation och bidra i de arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden som teamet tillsammans ansvarar för.


**Din profil**
--------------


Vi söker dig som har högskoleutbildning med inriktning inom lantmäteri, samhällsplanering eller IT, alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som likvärdig och relevant för tjänsten. Du har mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska i tal och skrift samt god förmåga att läsa och förstå engelska texter.


För att lyckas i rollen är det en fördel om du har arbetat med fastighetsinformation. Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om Lantmäteriets geodataprodukter (tjänstebaserat tillhandahållande, geodatatjänster) och tillhörande IT-system samt teknisk kunskap om geodatatjänster samt hur dessa fungerar. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet som systemförvaltare eller av att ha arbetat med kravarbete i utvecklingsprojekt. Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om modellering, kravarbete och acceptanstest Det är även meriterande om du kan läsa och tolka XML, läsa UML-diagram och XML-scheman och har en grundläggande förståelse för SQL.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är strukturerad och arbetar enligt en tydlig process, organiserar och planerar ditt arbete väl, slutför det som påbörjats och håller deadlines. Du hanterar stress på ett konstruktivt sätt och bibehåller ett gott humör vid press och motgångar. Du är samarbetsorienterad och anpassar dig och har ett prestigelöst fokus på det gemensamma målet. Du är även analytisk och lösningsorienterad och hittar snabbt lösningar på uppkomna problem samt löser problem utan att missa de långsiktiga strategierna, ser logik och samband i komplex information eller miljö.


Tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad vilket innebär att du måste vara svensk medborgare samt att en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll och säkerhetssamtal kommer att genomföras innan anställning.


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Lantmäteriet är i ständig utveckling och det är också alla vi som jobbar här, våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste resurs för att lyckas med vårt uppdrag. I medarbetarskapet ingår att vi agerar utifrån den statliga värdegrunden och våra värdeord: service, öppenhet och handlingskraft.


Som medarbetare på Lantmäteriet ska du kunna förena arbete med fritid och ha en bra balans i livet. När verksamheten tillåter har du bland annat möjlighet att utföra dina arbetsuppgifter till stor del på annan plats än kontoret. Läs mer om vårt erbjudande på lm.se/jobbahososs


För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på länken i annonsen. Vi arbetar med kompetensbaserad rekrytering och fokuserar på din kompetens för att bedöma dig och andra kandidater objektivt. Vi önskar att du inte bifogar något foto till din ansökan. Du som har skyddade personuppgifter ska inte lägga in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem, istället ber vi dig kontakta rekryterande chef.


Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonshjälp.


I denna rekrytering kommer vi att tillämpa sex månaders provanställning.


Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden. Arbetsprov på plats kan förekomma.


**Om Lantmäteriet**
-------------------


Lantmäteriet är den myndighet som kartlägger Sverige. Till våra uppgifter hör också att registrera och säkra ägandet av alla fastigheter samt hantera deras gränser. Nu söker vi dig som har ett starkt samhällsengagemang.


För att hus, broar och vägar ska kunna byggas behövs kunskap om Sveriges geografi och fastigheter. Genom att kartlägga verkligheten och tillhandahålla aktuell information om landets topografi och infrastruktur bidrar du därför till grunden för ett hållbart och fungerande samhälle.

title: Backend Software Engineer - Fully Remote (EU)
description:
**| Remote (Italy / EU) | Work from Anywhere in Italy or EU | Full-Time (40 hrs/week) |****About Us:**


Aladia is a fast-growing e-learning platform based in Italy, with a mission to transform digital education globally. We are passionate about innovation, learner-centered design, and delivering high-quality online learning experiences at scale.


We are looking for a **NestJS Backend Developer** ready to help us evolve our backend infrastructure into a modern, microservices-based system.

 **What You’ll Do:**

* Design, build, and maintain backend services using **NestJS (Node.js)**
* Develop robust and secure RESTful APIs
* Work with **MongoDB** to manage and structure data
* Collaborate using **Git** and branching workflows
* Apply clean architectural patterns (Controller-Service-Repository)
* Contribute to the growth of a **microservices-based** backend
* Use **Docker** for containerization and deployments
* Maintain quality through **CI/CD pipelines** and automated testing
* Document and test APIs with tools like **Apidog**
* Collaborate in agile sprints using **ClickUp**

 **Who We’re Looking For:**

* Developers with experience in **NestJS** and backend fundamentals
* Continuous learners who are eager to grow and improve
* Strong communicators who thrive in remote, multicultural teams
* Professionals seeking a **long-term role** in a dynamic startup environment

 **Work Schedule:**

* **Full-time** (40 hours/week)
* **Time zone:** Aligned with Italy (CET)
* Remote-first, international team

 **Perks & Benefits:**

* Continuous learning and professional growth
* Long-term contract and stability
* International, collaborative work environment
* Career opportunities in a growing tech company

 **Compensation:**

* Hourly: $5.00 – $20.00/hour
* Contract-to-Hire on UpWork

 **Application Process:**

* **Apply** with your CV and GitHub/portfolio
* **Initial screening call** with our team
* **1° Technical test** to evaluate coding skills
* **Interview** with a Backend Engineer
* **2° Technical test** to evaluate coding skills
* **Final interview** with our team


Notice: This is a remote position based in Sweden.

title: Lotsoperatör, tidsbegränsad anställning vid behov
description:
Sveriges vackraste arbetsplats söker en


**Lotsoperatör, tidsbegränsad anställning vid behov**
-----------------------------------------------------


med placering i Malmö


**Att arbeta som Lotsoperatör på Sjöfartsverket**  

Sjöfartsverket ansvarar för att tillhandahålla lotstjänster i svenska farvatten och även öppensjölotsningar. Som lotsoperatör kommer du att arbeta med att ta emot lotsbeställningarna och fördela lotsningsuppdrag samt aktivt planera logistiken efter rådande belastning och tillgång på resurser, dokumentera fartygs ankomst- och avgångstider samt sköta löpande administrativa uppgifter kopplade till lotsningsprocessen. Stundtals är arbetstempot högt och du förväntas kunna hantera flera skeenden samtidigt. Ibland förändras förutsättningarna med kort varsel och du måste snabbt göra om din planering. Arbetet utförs på oregelbundna tider såväl dag- som nattetid.


**Vem är du?**  

Vi söker dig som har lägst treårig gymnasieexamen. Det är viktigt att du kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift både på svenska och på engelska, likaså att du har god datorvana och med lätthet hanterar olika IT-system.


Utbildning inom logistik är meriterande eller erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med service, gärna inom logistikområdet. Det är meriterande om du har utbildning inom sjöfart och/eller erfarenhet inom sjöfart, SRC/ROC samt B-körkort för manuellt växlad bil. Om du inte redan har fartygsbefälklass VIII och SRC förväntas du genomgå en grundutbildning i dessa, via oss på Sjöfartsverket, innan du börjar utföra dessa arbetsuppgifter. Detta då det är en förutsättning för att tillåtas och kunna utföra arbetsuppdraget. Det är dock inte ett krav på att du innehar denna utbildning innan anställning hos oss.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi söker dig som är duktig på att planera, är stresstålig och kan fatta snabba beslut och prioritera om när förutsättningarna förändras. Du är kommunikativ och brinner för att ge god service till våra kunder. Eftersom du ansvarar för verksamheten tillsammans med ett team med flera lotsoperatörer är samarbetsförmåga, lösningsfokus och hög ansvarskänsla mycket viktiga egenskaper.


Tjänsten kan komma att kräva svenskt medborgskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras innan erbjudande om anställning.


**Varför ska du välja Sjöfartsverket?**  

Sjöfartsverket är ett tjänsteproducerande affärsverk inom transportsektorn. Vår arbetsmiljö är unik och vårt uppdrag är unikt – Sveriges vackraste arbetsplats. Vårt uppdrag är att utveckla transport och sjöfart i linje med riksdagens och regeringens beslut. Vår affärsidé är att erbjuda effektiva sjövägar, moderna tjänster och maritimt partnerskap för tillväxt, konkurrenskraft och hållbar utveckling.


Sjöfartsverket erbjuder en trivsam arbetsmiljö med goda möjligheter att förena arbetsliv och privatliv. Vi har en tydlig identitet och ett starkt varumärke. Vi är en utvecklingsinriktad organisation och arbetar ständigt för att utveckla våra medarbetare samt för att upprätthålla våra nöjda kunder. Är vi rätt organisation för dig är det en självklarhet för dig att agera på ett professionellt, öppet och engagerat sätt. Vårt arbete utgår från den statliga värdegrunden, vi arbetar också aktivt för jämställdhet, mångfald och inkludering och ser det som en självklarhet att du delar vår uppfattning.


**Hur och när?**  

Den här rekryteringen gäller en tidsbegränsad anställning vid behov som ska tillsättas snarast och som gäller i högst 12 månader från startdatum.


Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande.


**Upplysningar:**  

Chef Patrik Selind, 010-478 61 64 eller patrik.selind@sjofartsverket.se


F**ackliga företrädare:**  

Saco-S Patrik Wikand, OFR/ST Carl Cremonese, Seko Ib Bergström, samtliga kan nås via vår växel 0771-630000.


**Ansökan**:  

Registrera din ansökan senast 2:e november 2025.  

Diarienummer: 25-05589


*Sjöfartsverket gör kontinuerliga och aktiva val kring exponering och rekryteringsstöd i varje rekrytering. Vi undanber oss därför direktkontakt av annonsförsäljare, bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
Do you love turning raw data into valuable insights and building scalable data models? Join us as a Data Engineer at Jobylon!
  
  

Jobylon is a modern and flexible talent acquisition suite, helping enterprise companies reach their hiring goals and each employee their full potential. Founded in 2011, we’ve supported countless companies across industries to improve their ways of working, and are currently used by recruiters and Talent Acquisition specialists in over 80 countries. We pride ourselves on our dedication to being customer-first while delivering an excellent product experience.
  
  

The person we’re looking for is someone who enjoys bridging technology with business impact. In this role, you’ll transform application models into scalable data models, design data flows, and enable analytics queries that create real value for both our customers and internally. You’ll work with Python, SQL, and modern data tools to structure models and ensure performance, while also building and maintaining APIs and integrations.
  
  

You’ll be part of our Engineering team consisting of eighteen engineers working closely together from all over the world, but mainly from Sweden, the Netherlands, and Portugal.
  
  

What you’ll work on
  
  

Structuring and maintaining scalable data models for analytics
  
Designing and implementing data flows to extract and transform relevant data
  
Ensuring database performance and reliability with SQL and dbt
  
Writing and maintaining APIs and integrations (Django, Flask, FastAPI)
  
  

Why this role is interesting for you
  
  

You’ll combine coding in Python with designing data models that directly impact business value
  
You’ll work hands-on with SQL and modern data tools (dbt, Snowflake)
  
You’ll help shape how data is modeled, structured, and used at Jobylon
  
Wagner Barretto
  
Lead Engineer
  
"As an engineer, you get the chance to work close to the business and participate in project decisions. This makes our work feel more impactful on the business and our customers."
  
Martin Linder
  
CFO
  
"We are on an incredible journey and we have just started scratching the tip of the iceberg in terms of growth. If you want to be a part of building a function, this is really the place for you."
  
Elina Bergström
  
VP Customer Success
  
"Everyone at Jobylon is different, and that’s exactly what makes us work so well together. We always have each other’s backs and push one another to do things we didn’t think we could."
  
Emelie Möller
  
Team Lead Customer Success
  
"What I love most is that I get to grow together with an inspiring team which I'm gladly also calling my friends!"
  
  

We’re looking for someone who
  
  

Has solid programming skills in Python
  
Is proficient in SQL and relational databases
  
Can design and maintain REST APIs and integrations
  
Knows how to structure scalable data models for analytics
  
Is curious about how data creates value for customers and the business
  
  

Nice to have (but not required)
  
  

Familiarity with Snowflake and dbt
  
Experience with Django, Flask, or FastAPI
  
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS)
  
Background in data analytics
  
  

Why join us?
  
  

At Jobylon you’ll find a tight-knit, ambitious team that genuinely cares – about each other, about our customers, and about improving hiring on all fronts. You’ll be surrounded by smart, driven, and supportive people. We also love seeing people grow, so whatever path you want to grow into – we’re probably here for it.
  
  

**Location:** Remote (within the EU) or at our offices in Stockholm/Gothenburg/Jönköping
  
  

**Start date:** As soon as we find the right person
  
  

**Scope:** Full-time, mid-level
  
  

**Language:** English required
  
  

Interested? We’d love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out if you have any questions.
  
  

A People First culture!
  
  

Be part of building and scaling a company
  
  

J-cation - yearly trip with the whole team
  
  

Amazing benefits and perks
  
  

International career possibilities
  
  

Work with inspiring and recognisable brands
  
  

Jobylon is a modern and user-friendly hiring platform that is used by midsize and enterprise companies all over the world. Our platform helps HR, recruiters, and hiring managers streamline their recruitment processes and provides a standout candidate experience.
  
  

With an intuitive user interface and great flexibility to customize the platform to businesses' specific hiring process, Jobylon is designed to help to spend less time on administrative tasks and more time with candidates.
  
  

This is why recruiters and hiring managers from 1000 employers like McDonald’s, Capgemini, and Skanska love working in Jobylon.
  
  

GROWTH
  
We embrace GROWTH - as individuals, as a team, and as a business. We strive to learn continuously, think big, never settle — and be number one.
  
  

RESPECT
  
We lead with RESPECT - for our mission, our customers and each other. We take ownership and hold ourselves to a higher standard in everything we do.
  
  

IMPACT
  
We show up to make an IMPACT - to win together by making every role matter, every contribution count, and celebrating outcomes over output.
  
  

THRIVE
  
We create space to THRIVE - to feel happy and build meaningful moments together. Because when we thrive, we drive things forward.
  
  

Karin Bergström (Jobylon) | Contact Person

title: Praktik larmtekniker el-tele/IT
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
---------------------


Vi på avdelningen drift och underhåll ansvarar för tillsyn, reparation samt drift av områdena utemiljö, byggnad och installationer över tid med god teknisk status och nöjda kunder. Detta uppnås genom ett nära samarbete med kund, förvaltningens övriga avdelningar samt andra organisationer i staden. Avdelningen ansvarar för att genomförandet av besiktningar som myndigheter kräver samt bidrar till utvecklingen av energisparåtgärder. Vi utför de uppdrag som beställs av våra kunder.
  

  

Under våren har vår enhet larm, elteknik och hiss möjlighet att ta emot en praktikant! Inom området arbetar vi med tillsyn & skötsel samt reparationer vid våra verksamheter sett till larm, elteknik och hiss. Det är vår uppgift att se till att alla är trygga i de fastigheterna vi förvaltar. Vi ser till att regelverk, lagar och krav från bland annat räddningstjänsten, försäkringsbolag och Göteborgs stad följs. Du är med larmtekniker och felsöker på diverse larm- och säkerhetsinstallationer. Förekommande installationer är bl.a. inbrottslarm, brandlarm, passagesystem, lås/dörrautomation mm. Ni arbetar tillsammans för att skapa en god miljö för hyresgästen.
  

  

Praktikperiod: Tillträde enligt överenskommelse för praktik under vårterminen, ser dock gärna start i mars 2026.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------


Vi letar efter dig med ett stort intresse för området och som ser att denna praktik kan bli en nyttig del i din fortsatta utveckling i arbetslivet!
  

  

Vi ser gärna att du är en person som tar ett stort ansvar för ditt arbete, är noggrann, flexibel och kommunikativ. Du är teknikintresserad, har en vilja att arbeta tillsammans med andra och visa omtanke för våra kunder. Tillsammans arbetar vi på stadsfastighetsförvaltningen för att göteborgarna ska få det bra!
  

  

För att söka denna praktikplats behöver du en pågående eftergymnasial utbildning eller Komvux utbildning där LIA, VFU eller APL är en del av utbildningen. Önskvärd studieinriktning inom värme och ventilation, drifttekniker eller teknisk förvaltare.
  

  

Önskvärd studieinriktning är exempelvis el-säkerhet, larm, lås och passage.


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats i utveckling och med framåtanda. Våra medarbetare har breda och varierande kompetenser. Vi arbetar i trevliga lokaler och erbjuder medarbetarförmåner såsom flexibel arbetstid, friskvårdsbidrag och cykelförmåner. Stadsfastigheter arbetar för ett hållbart arbetsliv där du ska kunna kombinera ett spännande och givande arbetsliv med ett rikt liv också utanför arbetet. Vi erbjuder dig ett utvecklings- och innovationsklimat som ger dig goda möjligheter till karriärutveckling. Inom förvaltningen tillämpar vi ett tillitsbaserat ledarskap som grundar sig i den inkluderande arbetsplatsen.  

Vi strävar efter att ha en jämn fördelning mellan kvinnor och män och en spridning när det gäller ålder på vår förvaltning. Vi vill att vår arbetsplats ska präglas av öppenhet och respekt för olikheter och vi tror att mångfald bidrar till att utveckla vår verksamhet.  

  

Till dig som företräder bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag: Vi undanber oss vänligt men bestämt erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.
**Om Stadsfastighetsförvaltningen**
-----------------------------------


Stadsfastighetsförvaltningen skapar miljöer där livet får ta plats genom att planera, bygga, hyra in, förvalta och utveckla lokaler och utemiljöer för Göteborgs Stads verksamheter. Varje dag är hundratusentals göteborgare verksamma i förskolor, skolor, vård- och omsorgsboenden och andra lokaler som vi sköter om.  

Gemensamt med stadsmiljöförvaltingen, exploateringsförvaltningen och stadsbyggnadsförvaltningen har vi ett samordnat ansvar för stadsutvecklingen i Göteborgs stad. Detta innebär en delad ansvarsfördelning och roller utifrån skeden: planering; genomförande och förvaltning med mål att bidra till en sammanhållen, effektiv och transparent stadsutveckling för boende, besökare och näringsliv i staden.
  
**Ansökningsinformation**
-------------------------


**Sista ansökningsdatum**
2025-10-31

**Referensnummer**
C281890

-----------------------


**Omfattning**
Heltid

1

Tidsbegränsad anställning
**Tillträde**
Enligt överenskommelse

-------------------

HR-specialist
