*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Testledare
description:
*Vill du arbeta i en organisation där IT gör verklig skillnad för människors vardag? IT-centrum vid Region Jönköpings län söker nu en engagerad och erfaren testledare som vill arbeta kundnära i dynamiska och komplexa IT-miljöer. Hos oss får du vara med och utveckla samhällskritiska lösningar – för ett bättre liv i en attraktiv region*.

### **Rollen som** **testledare**


Som testledare hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att stärka och vidareutveckla vår test- och kvalitetssäkringsverksamhet. Du får en omväxlande och utvecklande roll i ett kompetent team, där din insats påverkar både invånare och medarbetare i hela regionen. Vi erbjuder en arbetsmiljö som präglas av öppenhet, delaktighet och hög kompetens – där du ges möjlighet att växa tillsammans med oss.  

  

I rollen som testledare kommer du att vara en del av vårt testteam och samtidigt ha en aktiv roll i projekt och förvaltningar inom regionens IT-verksamhet. Du ansvarar för planering, koordinering och genomförande av testaktiviteter i olika faser – från analys till produktionssättning. Arbetet omfattar även analys, riskbedömning och kravställning kopplat till kvalitetssäkring.  

  

Du fungerar som ambassadör för testområdet inom regionen och säkerställer att processer och metoder kring test och kvalitet implementeras, följs upp och kontinuerligt förbättras. Din roll blir central i vårt arbete med att säkerställa robusta och användarvänliga IT-lösningar i en verksamhet som aldrig står still. Vi erbjuder en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde enligt överenskommelse.

### **Din blivande arbetsplats**


IT-centrum stödjer invånare, patienter och medarbetare i Region Jönköpings Län med digitala lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. Vi är drivna av att möta regionens behov av IT-tjänster och att vara proaktiva i att identifiera möjligheter för verksamhetsutveckling genom effektiv IT. IT-centrum har ett samlat ansvar för IT-verksamheten i Region Jönköpings län. I ett nära samarbete med våra kunder medverkar vi till att regionens verksamheter utvecklas och stöds med bra IT-lösningar. Vi arbetar processorienterat och kvalitetsmedvetet i enlighet med vårt ISO-certifierade verksamhetssystem. Vi är idag över 250 engagerade och framåtlutade medarbetare med hög kompetens och framåtanda inom sina respektive ansvarsområden. Vår vision är att skapa ett län där människor vill leva, arbeta och utvecklas – med god hälsa, bra miljö och ett rikt kulturliv. IT är en viktig del av denna helhet. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att bli Sveriges bästa IT-avdelning.  

  

Du kommer ingå i enhet RTS – Regional utveckling, trafik och stöd som förvaltar och driver projekt kopplat till system för bland annat Länstrafiken, Verksamhet & Service Regional Utveckling (inklusive Smålands Musik & teater samt fyra skolor).

### **Din profil**


För att vara aktuell för tjänsten ska du ha en relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT alternativt annan utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig. Du ska inneha certifiering inom testledning, exempelvis ISTQB eller motsvarande. Vi ser gärna att du har tidigare erfarenhet av testledning och kvalitetssäkring av komplexa IT-system. Det är en bonus om du också har erfarenhet av verksamhetsnära system, automatiserade tester (exempelvis SoapUI) och prestandatester.  

  

För att trivas i rollen som testledare hos oss ser vi att du är en strukturerad och resultatorienterad person med stark analytisk och pedagogisk förmåga. Du kommunicerar tydligt, samarbetar smidigt och har en förmåga att engagera både kunder och kollegor. För oss på IT-centrum är förändring en naturlig del av vardagen vilket innebär att du som person också behöver vara flexibel och trivas i denna miljö som följer med i teknikens framfart. Du behöver även vara flexibel att kunna se både helheten och detaljerna i dina arbetsuppgifter. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet, och söker dig som visar ett ödmjukt och tydligt ledarskap. Du delar gärna med dig av din kompetens och har en stark vilja att bidra till såväl din egen som teamets och verksamhetens utveckling.

### **Vårt erbjudande till dig**

* Vi utlovar spännande och varierande arbetsuppgifter i en dynamisk miljö.
* Du får möjlighet att påverka och planera ditt eget arbete.
* Trygg och flexibel arbetsplats med upp till 2 dagar per vecka på distans.
* Vi har friskvårdsbidrag samt goda utbildnings- och utvecklingsmöjligheter
* Hälsofrämjande arbetsplats med gemensamma aktiviteter och fokus på välmående.


Som medarbetare hos oss inom Region Jönköpings län får du tillgång till våra anställningsförmåner. En del av dem ökar din grundtrygghet, andra sätter lite guldkant på vardagen. Läs mer om våra förmåner här: Förmåner, Region Jönköpings län

### **Har du frågor om tjänsten?**


Vill du veta mer kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta enhetschef Fredrik Höher på tel. 070-682 27 61 för mer information.  

  

Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.

### **Vår rekryteringsprocess**


Vi genomför intervjuer och rekrytering löpande före sista ansökningsdag söndagen 2:a november.  

Välkommen med din ansökan och bli en del av vårt team!  

  

Läs mer om Region Jönköpings läns rekryteringsprocess på vår hemsida: Vår rekryteringsprocess, Region Jönköpings län

title: Systemförvaltare till Servicecenter Ekonomi
description:
Sista ansökningsdagen: 2025-10-24



Referensnummer: C281086

  


**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------


Sundsvalls kommun är en av Norrlands största arbetsgivare med runt 8 000 medarbetare och över 300 yrken. Tillsammans fyller vi ett av de viktigaste uppdragen i samhället – att skapa nytta och värde för invånare, företag och framtida generationer. Oavsett verksamhet arbetar vi för samma sak, att vi ska vara en bra plats att bo, leva och verka på. Just nu befinner vi oss i en spännande utvecklingsfas. Vi är en föregångare inom digital utveckling och artificiell intelligens, och leder arbetet med att skapa smarta lösningar för framtidens offentliga sektor. Sundsvall har en central roll i den gröna omställningen i norra Sverige. Vi är övertygade om att de rätta platserna för den omställningen är här. Som kommun förbereder vi oss för att växa bland annat genom att bereda mark, skapa nya utbildningsplatser, marknadsföra kommunen och välkomna nya invånare från hela världen. Servicecenter Ekonomi är en del av Sundsvalls Kommuns Servicecenter. Vi arbetar koncerngemensamt och ansvarar för att förvalta, utveckla och tillgängliggöra digitala tjänster och IT-stöd som bidrar till en effektiv och modern ekonomiadministration. Vi söker nu en systemförvaltare till vårt standardsystem Raindance som används av Sundsvalls Kommun och de kommunala bolagen. Du blir en del av Servicecenter Ekonomi där du tillsammans med två systemadministratörer arbetar för att stödja och utveckla en viktig funktion inom Sundsvalls kommuns Servicecenter.



Arbetsuppgifter
----------------


Som systemförvaltare ansvarar du för förvaltning och utveckling av Raindance. Du leder och, planerar funktionens arbete samt följer upp uppdrag, och driver förbättringar tillsammans med systemadministratörerna. Tillsammans säkerställer ni att systemet fungerar som det ska och att det ständigt utvecklas med användaren och ökad digitalisering och automatisering i fokus. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar: • Felsökning och användarsupport i informationssystem. • Planering och genomförande av systemuppgraderingar, förbättringsaktiviteter och underhåll. • Hantering av användarbehörighet enligt säkerhetsrutiner. • Dokumentation, rapportering och framtagning av användarstöd. • Analys och förbättring av system utifrån prestanda och användarbehov.



Kvalifikationer
----------------


Vi söker dig med akademisk utbildning inom IT och systemförvaltning eller med några års relevant erfarenhet av de aktuella arbetsuppgifterna. Du har några års erfarenhet av arbete inom systemförvaltning. Tjänsten kräver god förmåga att utrycka sig i tal och skrift såväl på svenska som på engelska. Det är meriterande om du har: • Erfarenhet av systemförvaltning av system inom ekonomi- eller businessintelligence. • Erfarenhet av leverantörsstyrning. • Erfarenhet av att leda utvecklingsuppdrag eller projekt. • Grundläggande kunskap om ekonomiska processer och begrepp. Som person är du strukturerade med god förmåga att planera och organisera ditt arbete, samtidigt som du aktivt bidrar till att bygga och upprätthålla strukturer i processer, rutiner och dokumentationer. Du tar egna initiativ och driver frågor framåt med tydligt fokus på lösningar. Du har en god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra för att nå gemensamma mål. Din analytiska förmåga hjälper dig att att identifiera och förstå problem, och du har en kreativ sida som ser möjligheter till förbättringar som gynnar både verksamheten och användarna. Vi lägger stor vikt i personlig lämplighet!



Anställningsvillkor
--------------------

**Tjänsteort:** Sundsvall

**Antal tjänster:** 1

**Anställningsform:** Tillsvidareanställning

**Omfattning:** Heltid

**Tillträde:** Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.



Övrigt
-------


Är du intresserad av att läsa mer om Sundsvall? Klicka in på www.sundsvall.se eller är du intresserad av hur det vore att bo och arbeta i Sundsvall kan du läsa mer på www.nykommun.se/kommun/sundsvall/ Vi verkar för en drogfri arbetsmiljö och drogtest kan förekomma vid nyanställning av personal. Vi tillämpar rökfri arbetstid. I Sundsvalls kommun gillar vi olika och välkomnar medarbetare med olika bakgrund. Vi värnar om det värde som jämn könsfördelning samt mångfald tillför våra verksamheter och arbetar för att våra arbetsplatser ska vara tillgängliga för alla. För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen samt möjliggöra god kommunikation med våra sökande ber vi dig söka tjänsten genom länken i denna annons. Är du även intresserad av att arbeta som räddningstjänstpersonal i beredskap/deltidsbrandman, klicka på länken: https://www.rtjmedelpad.se/om-oss/jobba-hos-oss/raddningstjanstpersonal-i-beredskap-rib Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonsering- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.


**Kontakt**
-----------

### **Robert Weidman**


Vision


Telefon: Nås via kommunens växel 060-19 10 00

### **Birgitta Graeve**


Sektionschef


Telefon: 060-192454

title: Datakoordinator med fokus på IT & Hållbarhet i Stockholm!
description:
### **Om rollen:**


Vi söker en **Data Coordinator** till ett spännande uppdrag inom hållbarhet och IT. Du blir en viktig del i ett strategiskt initiativ för Sustainable IT, där ditt arbete bidrar till att kartlägga och kvalitetssäkra data om IT-infrastruktur, allt från datorer och servrar till nätverksutrustning och AI-system.


Du kommer att ta emot rådata från olika källor, strukturera den och säkerställa att den är korrekt och redo att användas i standardiserade Excel-mallar för vidare analys och rapportering.

### **Dina ansvarsområden:**

* Koordinera med projektledare, interna kontakter och externa parter för att samla in data
* Säkerställa att all levererad data är komplett och korrekt
* Föra logg över avvikelser och kommunicera tillbaka till datakällor för korrigering
* Strukturera och överföra data till fördefinierade Excel-mallar
* Dokumentera antaganden och manuella justeringar
* Bidra till att insamlad data kan användas i beräkningar av klimatpåverkan
* Delta i workshops och uppföljningsmöten

### **Vi tror att du har:**

* Stark erfarenhet av Excel (pivot-tabeller, datavalidering m.m.)
* Förståelse för IT-infrastruktur och klassificering
* Skicklighet i att hantera stora mängder data med noggrannhet
* Plus i kanten om du har erfarenhet av hållbarhetsarbete eller emissionsberäkningar
* Goda kommunikationsförmågor på svenska och engelska

### **Vi söker dig som är**


En person med rätt balans mellan noggrannhet och samarbetsförmåga. Du trivs i tvärfunktionella team, men är också bekväm med att arbeta självständigt och driva ditt eget arbete framåt.

### **Praktiska detaljer:**


**Start:** 9 oktober 2025  

  

**Slut:** 6 november 2025  

  

**Plats:** Stockholm, med vissa resor inkluderat  

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 6 oktober 2025


Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Erfaren IT-supporttekniker 2lind till offentlig sektor!
description:
Är du en tekniskt vass problemlösare som brinner för IT-support och användarnära service? Vi söker nu en **Supporttekniker 2nd line** som vill bli en nyckelspelare i ett dedikerat servicedesk-team.

-------------


Här får du en bred och dynamisk vardag där du arbetar både med **PC- och Mac-miljöer** och stöttar kollegor såväl på plats som via vår servicedesk. Du kommer att:

--------------

️ Flerårig erfarenhet av support i både 1st & 2nd line  

️ ITIL Foundation  

️ Mycket goda kunskaper i Windows 11, Intune och Azure  

️ Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att supportera **Mac-användare**

---------------------

title: Junior IT-Supporttekniker till kommun
description:
### **OM JOBBET**


Vi söker en driven och serviceinriktad IT-Supporttekniker till vår kund i Täby. Du kommer att utföra på-plats-support till användare i allmänna IT-frågor/Helpdesk och på plats i kommunens olika verksamheter. Vi söker dig som kan börja omgående. Uppdraget pågår inledningsvis till årsskiftet, med goda möjligheter till förlängning eller anställning.

### **OM FÖRETAGET**


Kunden är en av Sveriges mest välskötta kommuner med stor valfrihet, välfärdstjänster av hög kvalitet, attraktivt näringslivsklimat och stabil ekonomi. Skolorna i kommunen uppvisar toppresultat, förskolorna erbjuder en trygg och stimulerande miljö och vid kommunens äldreboenden är nöjdheten stor. Läget är attraktivt med närhet till både Stockholm och Arlanda, samtidigt som tillgången till skog, hav och strövområden ger möjlighet till naturupplevelser och rekreation.

### **ARBETSUPPGIFTER**


Kontakt med användare sker via telefon (bemanna Servicedesk) och ärendehanteringssystem men även att bemanna supportdesk och hjälpa användare fysiskt på plats hos kundens kontor. Även support/ärendehantering på plats i kommunens olika verksamheter förekommer. Konsulten ska arbeta på plats hos kundens lokaler.

### **ERFARENHETER OCH EGENSKAPER**

* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom IT-support (LIA/praktik ej inräknat)
* B-körkort är ett krav

### **ÖVRIGT**


Plats: Täby


Start: Omgående


Kvällsarbete kan förekomma.

### **OM D-SOURCE**

*Your source to IT*  

D-Source är ett modernt konsultbolag med bredden mellan helpdesk, infrastruktur och Tech. Vi har lång erfarenhet av att förstå kunders IT-behov! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du är intresserad av att ta reda på mer.


Vad kan vi göra för dig och vad kan vi göra tillsammans?

### **INGET JOBB FÖR DIG?**

Lugnt! Du kan alltid registrera dig förutsättningslöst på D-Source jobbsida genom att Connecta med oss. Då hamnar du i vår kandidatdatabas och får koll på våra kommande aktuella tjänster.

title: Senior Data Engineer / Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
We are now looking for a Senior Data Engineer / Senior Analytics Engineer to strengthen our clients data team in Stockholm. In this role you will build and develop a Databricks-based platform, designing robust ETL pipelines, data models and CI/CD processes that transform business needs into high-quality data products.

### **What you will do**

* Develop and improve ETL pipelines in Databricks (PySpark / SQL).
* Collect requirements from business stakeholders and translate them into data products.
* Model data according to Kimball principles and document solutions.
* Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps (YAML, artifact handling).
* Ensure access control and data cleaning routines.
* Monitor platform performance, handle job alerts and incidents in ServiceNow.

### **Must-have qualifications**

* Hands-on experience with Databricks using PySpark and Spark SQL.
* Data modelling knowledge based on Kimball principles.
* Strong communication skills in Swedish and English.
* Experience with CI/CD, YAML pipelines and artifact handling.
* Experience with unit and integration testing.
* Ability to document architecture, data models and operations.

### **Nice-to-have qualifications**

* Experience working in Azure environments.
* Knowledge of Databricks Asset Bundle (DAB).

### **Practical information**

* Location: Stockholm (on-site, no remote)
* Assignment period: 1 November 2025 – 31 March 2026


Does this sound like your next challenge? Apply now and join us in delivering high-quality data solutions that truly make a difference.

title: Software Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Apply modern software engineering principles to design, develop, test, and maintain robust and scalable applications.
* Be an active member of a cross-functional Scrum team, contributing throughout the product lifecycle.
* Drive continuous improvement in both our technical solutions and development practices.
* Mentor and support junior developers, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
* Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer with strong proficiency in:
* .NET platform (C#)
* SQL and relational databases
* Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure, including:
* Containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Authorization and identity management
* Experience with event-driven architectures and tools such as Apache Kafka
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and tools such as:
* GitHub Actions
* ArgoCD
* GitOps practices
* Experience with
* Blazor (or similar front-end frameworks)
* RESTful APIs
* Entity Framework
* Solid understanding of automated test practices
* Proficient in Git and version control workflows
* Experience working in Scrum or other agile methodologies.

  

**Meritorious**  

* Experience with cloud-native observability tools (e.g. OpenTelemetry)
* Background in the automotive or manufacturing industry.

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 06-10-2025

  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Kotlin Ktor - Senior Backend Engineer (Svensktalande)
description:
**Providing Value & Impact - SwedQ.**


SwedQ is a consultancy company that has lately proven to have a unique model for those who want to grow, create a legacy, and take on challenges where you add value and gain value. Year after year, we have managed to serve clients within all types of industries (intentionally except for gambling and weaponry), as well as grow each year in revenue, the number of people working with us, and the scale of our deliveries.


We are looking for someone who wants to be part of the company in a literal sense. That means taking on the technical challenges as well as getting a portion of the company in the future. And if you like, driving forward an idea and implementing it with us. You will be working closely with everyone, which makes it easy to implement changes that you believe in.

**What's in it for you?**  

The question goes back to you: what do you want (with common sense or not)? Some are looking for fixed salaries, pensions, and the stability around it. Some want a bigger part of the cake and to share the risk. Let’s talk it through. One thing is for certain: we are going to make sure that you find your "it," either with us in-house or with the clients. We will be designing the role based on what works for you and for us. The good thing is you will find people who are technically savvy, an opportunity to teach and learn—if not technically, maybe about entrepreneurship? We know, a lot of questions. That’s why we have interviews, right?

**Who are you?**


* Multi-disciplined engineer with a primary language of Kotlin and Ktor
* Swedish speaking - svensktalande. (We speak mainly english in the office, but now we are looking for someone who is Swedish speaking)
* Strong foundation in programming fundamentals such as data structures and algorithms
* Understands architectural designs and has an understanding of flow
* Worked in more than 3 types of domains
* Knows how to manage and create deployments/ingress with tools such as GitHub, Gradle & CircleCI, Kubernetes clusters, and Docker containers
* Worked with either AWS, GCP, or Azure. Preferably done large-scale cloud computing, optimized performance with cost reductions. Maybe migrated?
* Has self-leadership and is a good communicator. Not talking about being like Jordan Belfort—you probably know what we mean


**SwedQ culture**  

It started out with siblings, who brought in people they knew, and in turn, they recommended other friends. Then we scaled further and recruited people through open head-hunting. Over time, we became a lot of people with different backgrounds, experiences, and insights. We made sure to amplify it further by embracing independence and accountability, driving forward value-creating work while making sure we’re having fun with epic football tournaments, unforgettable trips, and dinners.

**Perks & Benefits**

* Competitive salary
* You decide your preferred salary model
* Budget to spend on health and gym
* Generous developer budget
* Monthly payments into your additional pension fund
* Private health insurance
* Private healthcare
* Office in the city – a stone’s throw from public transport and lunch restaurants
* Breakfast in the SwedQ office EVERYDAY
* Support for open-source projects and community engagement
* Kick-ass colleagues and mentors at every corner
* Company car (or car allowance)
* Making sure that your work fits your private life. We offer benefits such as home cleaning and childcare support

title: LIA Praktik inom IT
description:
*Är du student inom IT och söker en LIA-praktikplats där du får möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken? Vi erbjuder nu LIA-platser inom vårt affärsområde IT, med fokus på* bland annat Säkerhet och Nätverk. Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa i en dynamisk och tekniskt utmanande miljö.


Avoki erbjuder flexibla, säkra och hållbara IT-lösningar som tar kunden in i framtiden. Vi har erfarenhet inom branschen och specialistkompetens inom flera områden. Nyckeln till vår framgång ligger i ett fokus på kunderna och kärnverksamheten i kombination med våra medarbetares vidareutveckling. Vi trivs tillsammans och ser det som en självklarhet att dela med oss av kunskap, kompetens och insikter.

**Som LIA-praktikant hos oss kommer du att:**

* Få möjlighet att fördjupa dina kunskaper inom områden som cybersäkerhet, nätverksinfrastruktur eller artificiell intelligens.
* Arbeta tillsammans med erfarna kollegor i ett innovativt och dynamiskt team.
* Delta i spännande projekt och bidra till konkreta lösningar för våra kunder.
* Få värdefull praktisk erfarenhet och insikt i hur IT-lösningar utvecklas och implementeras i praktiken.


Vi erbjuder en utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet att växa och skaffa dig kunskaper som förbereder dig för din framtida karriär.


I din ansökan behöver du specificera:

* Vad du studerar
* Vilken period du söker LIA för och på vilken ort
* Vilket område du är mest intresserad av att praktisera inom


För att hantera den stora mängden LIA-ansökningar ber vi dig att **inte skicka ansökan via mejl**. Alla ansökningar till LIA-praktik görs istället här via vår karriärsida.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan och att få vara med på din resa mot en framtid inom IT!

title: Senior Software Engineer - Java
description:
**What You Will Do**

* As a backend Java developer, you will work within a specific problem space critical to Klarna’s current needs where you will design, develop and deploy backend services with a focus on scalability, high availability and low latency
* Collaborate and grow in a dynamic and autonomous environment while working in small, agile and cross functional teams
* Use the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale

* Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices

 **Closing**  

Please include a CV in English.

title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
*Knodd är Sveriges främsta digitala vårdtjänst för barn. Vi startades för att ge trygghet åt föräldrar och barn, och har idag hjälpt över hundratusen nöjda föräldrar.* *Nu söker vi en stjärna till vårt tech team som vill vara med på resan.*

 **Om verksamheten**


Knodd är en digital vårdtjänst som låter småbarnsföräldrar träffa erfarna barnspecialister via videosamtal och följa sina barns hälsa och utveckling. Det operativa teamet består av 9 personer och vi har över 100 barnsjuksköterskor och barnläkare som bemannar vården. Vi är idag Sveriges mest populära vårdtjänst för småbarnsföräldrar och har ambitioner att bredda erbjudandet för att fortsätta förbättra vardagen för barn och föräldrar.

 **Om rollen**


Rollen som utvecklare på Knodd är bred och innebär ansvar på många områden. Som utvecklare på Knodd kommer du:

* Jobba i ett tight tech team på 3-4 personer som tillsammans med design och business tar strategiska produktbeslut
* Ha en flexibel roll där både frontend, backend och DevOps-uppgifter är aktuella
* Arbeta med en modern tech stack och ha mycket inflytande över tekniska beslut
* Jobba med fokus på testning och säkerhet för att bygga stabila och säkra produkter

 **Tech stack**


Vår tech stack består bland annat av:

* TypeScript
* NodeJS
* React och React Native
* AWS Serverless
* MongoDB

 **Om dig**

* Du är en driven utvecklare med relevant erfarenhet
* Du vill vara med och bygga en förstklassig produkt inom ett område som gör skillnad
* Du vill vara en del av ett tight team och känna ägandeskap över den produkt du utvecklar
* Du är öppen och nyfiken att lära dig när du inte kan eller vet
* Du är noggrann, tycker om att släppa features ofta och se dem i händerna på användare
* Du förstår och pratar svenska

 **Om oss**


Vi är ett litet team hängivna att skänka trygghet till småbarnsföräldrar och omvälva en traditionell bransch genom att nyttja innovativ teknik och digitala upplevelser av högsta kvalitet. Vi fokuserar just nu på att bredda vårt erbjudande vilket kommer med flera spännande produktsatsningar under vintern/våren.

 **Kontor & Distansarbete**


Vi har ingen strikt policy kring distansarbete men det generella riktmärket är att vi är på kontoret minst 50%. Kontoret ligger på Östra Hamngatan i centrala Göteborg och där hittar vi även på teamaktiviter som onsdagsfrukost och Team-AWs

title: Manager Contract Coordinator
company_industry: Mining, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
**Boliden is a high-tech metals company with its own mines and smelters that works long-term to guarantee society's access to base and precious metals. For a century, our work has been part of the value chains that have shaped modern society. At Boliden, we know that the metals we mine and make available will continue to play a crucial role in the future – what matters is how we produce them. Become a part of us and drive change for generations to come.**
**Your opportunity**
 As Manager Contract Coordinator (Contract Administration), you will step into a key leadership role at Boliden Smelters. Here, you’ll have the chance to lead and develop a team of fourteen people responsible for the administration of purchase and sales contracts for the refined metal sales . You will play a central part in driving improvements, ensuring high quality and efficiency, and shaping the way we work going forward.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In this role, you will lead, coach, and develop a professional team within contract administration and logistics. The team members are in Stockholm, UK and Germany. You will set clear goals, provide ongoing feedback, and foster an inclusive and motivating work environment. Your responsibilities include ensuring the execution of purchase and sales contracts from handover to final payment, overseeing the administration of inbound and outbound product flows, and providing pricing data for risk management. You will ensure contract compliance, advise stakeholders on contractual rights and obligations, and take an active part in performance reviews, recruitment, salary setting, and development initiatives. You will also make decisions within budget, approve invoices according to attestation rules, and drive change by developing working methods for increased efficiency and quality.
   

  

**Examples of leadership behaviors:**
* You take a hands-on approach, emphasizing teamwork and development within your group.
* You communicate clearly, set expectations, and coach your team members to grow.
* You create engagement and motivation, show decisiveness and responsibility for results, and are proactive in driving improvement and change.
* Building strong relationships both internally and externally comes naturally to you, and you always lead by example with integrity and respect.


**What You Bring**
 You have a university degree in finance or a related field, and documented experience in leading teams within administration, logistics, or contract management. You have an excellent command of English, both spoken and written, and experienced working methods and continuous improvement. Your strong business acumen and structured, goal-oriented approach set you apart as a leader.
   

  

**Who You Will Work With**
 You will report to the Metals Director, BA Smelters, and work closely with internal stakeholders such as Finance, Risk Management, and other teams within Smelters. Externally, you will interact with suppliers, customers, and service partners, including IT, ESG and Finance departments.
   

  

**Why work with us:**
 At Boliden, we believe in creating a workplace where care, courage, and responsibility guide everything we do. We offer a supportive and collaborative environment and if you are passionate about making a difference and ready to take on a role that offers both challenge and growth, we would like to hear from you.
   

  

**Apply today to be part of something truly meaningful!**
 At Boliden, diversity and inclusion are drivers of innovation. We know that different perspectives and experiences strengthen us and help us stay at the forefront of an important and exciting industry. Therefore, we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and viewpoints. Together, we build a workplace where everyone can feel safe and inspired to reach their full potential.
   

  

**Apply before 23rd of October 2025**
 Selection will be ongoing, so we are looking forward to receiving your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Do you want to know more about the position? Please contact Sven Hjelmstedt, Director Sales, Commercial, BA Smelters via mail to sven.hjelmstedt@boliden.com.
   

  

 Questions regarding your application are answered by Talent Acquisition Partner Jessica Grönwall via mail: jessica.gronwall@ext.boliden.com
   

  

 Union information is available from Andreas Mårtensson (Unionen) +46 70-541 83 93, Ingela Scherling (SACO) +46 70-272 08 68, Peter Markström (Ledarna) +46 910-77 40 09
   

  

*If you are a representative of a recruiting firm, please refrain from contacting us about this posting. We appreciate your consideration.* 
  

  

 Important! If you are a current employee within Boliden you shouldn't complete the application at this site, please log on to your Workday account and apply through "Find Jobs".

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
* Stockholm, Sweden
* Support
* Full Time


 Add to favourites Favourite View favourites
   

  

 RLDatix (RLD) is on a mission to help raise the standard of care…everywhere. Trusted by over 10,000 healthcare organizations around the world, our solutions help improve health and care. Our applications ensure that patients receive the best and safest care while supporting the providers who deliver it.
   

  

 Joining TeamRLD means being part of a global effort of over 2,000 team members in making a difference in healthcare…every day.
   

  

 In Sweden, RLDatix helps organizations deliver safer, more secure welfare through cloud-based workforce planning solutions that streamline operations, ensure quality, and create better working environments. As societal changes increase the complexity of scheduling and staffing, we provide innovative solutions that improve efficiency without compromising quality, working closely with customers to meet challenges with passion and agility. Today, RLDatix is the market leader in scheduling and staffing in the Swedish municipal and regional markets with our Time Care Planering and Time Care Pool software solutions.
   

  

 We’re searching for a Stockholm-based Technical Support Specialist to join our Support team, so that we can ensure our customers receive seamless technical assistance and outstanding service experience. The Technical Support Specialist will troubleshoot, resolve, and document technical issues to ensure customers can maximize the use of RLDatix workforce management solutions.
   

  

**How You’ll Spend Your Time**
* Provide technical assistance and customer support to ensure smooth operations and quick resolution of issues
* Execute scripts and run database queries in order to support troubleshooting and resolve complex cases
* Diagnose and resolve performance and integration-related issues to maintain high system reliability
* Collaborate with customers’ IT departments, integration partners, and internal development teams in order to solve advanced problems
* Install and configure our on-premise applications (Time Care Planering and Time Care Pool) to enable successful deployments


**What Kind of Things We’re Most Interested in You Having**
* Experience in troubleshooting, installation, and customer support resolving technical issues
* Proficiency with remote tools (e.g., Team Viewer), Office 365, and ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk or Salesforce)
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish (verbal and written) and English is a must
* Education at the college level (High School/Gymnasium), preferably in technical/IT fields
* Strong problem-solving ability and interest in delivering great customer support
* Team-oriented mindset, with a knack for collaborating across borders and disciplines


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge of workforce scheduling systems such as Time Care Planering or Time Care Pool
* Database troubleshooting and familiarity with Visual Studio or similar tools
* Experience working in an international, process-oriented organization
* University-level education in IT or related fields


 By enabling flexibility in how we work and prioritizing employee wellness, we empower our team to do and be their best.
   

  

 RLDatix is an equal opportunity employer, and our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, gender, sexual identity, national origin, disability, handicap, marital status or any other status or condition protected by law.
   

  

 As part of RLDatix’s commitment to the inclusion of all qualified individuals, we ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation in the job application and interview process. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in either step, please don’t hesitate to send a note to accessibility@rldatix.com.

title: Business Analyst, Supply Planning
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 We are looking for a curious and self-driven Business Analyst to join our Supply Planning Unit. In this role, you will lead analytics initiatives and maintain and develop systems for all three Reverse Supply areas (External Exit and overstock selling, faulty items and garment collection). You’ll play a key part in the team in helping unwanted garments get a new life, and ensure the garments end up in the right place! As a proactive self-starter, you will take ownership of projects from hypothesis to insight and delivery, thrive on ambiguity, ask the right questions, and challenge the status quo. This position requires a blend of business acumen and analytical skills.
   

  

*Your key responsibilities include:*
* Lead analytics initiatives from hypothesis to delivery, turning data into actionable insights.
* Own and develop internal applications supporting overstock sales and partner management.
* Use SQL and Power BI to gather, clean, and visualize data.
* Develop and maintain web-based applications, hence exposure to C#, JavaScript, and PowerApps or similar languages and programs are required.
* Maintain and follow-up on sustainability KPIs for business development and public disclosure.
* Act as the go-to person for data and application-related questions and incidents
* Drive automation and data validation in areas with manual processes.
* Collaborate cross-functionally within Supply Planning and across H&M Group.


**Who You Are**
 Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a business-minded, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability, business acumen, self-drive with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.
   

  

*We are looking for people with*
* Minimum 3 years of experience in a data-driven role within supply chain operations, ideally in overstock handling, returns management, or circular fashion initiatives.
* Proven hands-on experience with SQL for querying large datasets, and Power BI for building dashboards and visualizing KPIs. Experience with Python or other programming language for automation, C# for application logic, and JavaScript for web-application development is needed.
* Experience with Power Automate for workflow optimization is a strong plus.
* Some experience from working with Cloud Platforms and maintaining web-based applications, especially in the context of internal business applications and data pipelines


*And people who are*
* Strong communicators and storytellers with the skills and ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various different stakeholders.
* Curious and take the initiative, driven to explore new ideas, ask questions, and take ownership from start to finish
* Based in Stockholm and able to commute to the office 4 days/week (no relocation support).


 This is a permanent position starting as soon as possible and you will report to Julia Lindberg, Reverse Supply Manager within Supply Planning.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your CV and English as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.
* In addition to our global benefits, our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. (Example: Competitive compensation for your dedication and long-term commitment. A day off on your birthday to relax and celebrate your special day. Special gift to celebrate the birth of your child, etc.)


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

  

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Data Management & Governance Facilitator
description:
At BMW Group, everything starts with passion. It turns a profession into a vocation. It drives us to keep reinventing mobility and bring innovative ideas onto the roads. Enthusiasm for joint projects turns a team into a strong unit where every opinion is valued. It is only when expertise, highly professional processes and enjoyment of work unite that we can shape the future together.
 



  





 BMW has embarked on an exciting journey towards becoming a more data-driven organization. As part of this transformation, we have established a dedicated data function to drive strategic and effective data-driven decision making across the organization. To lead this effort locally, we are looking for a motivated Data Management and Governance Facilitator (DMGF) to join our team. In this role, you will not only play a crucial part in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the integrity, security, and effective utilization of our data assets, but also act as a driver of technological empowerment—keeping the organization up-to-date on emerging technologies (like AI). As the role is still relatively new, you will have the unique opportunity of shaping it and growing in it.
 



  





 What awaits you?
 



 As the DMGF, you will play a crucial role in establishing and maintaining effective data management and governance processes across the organization (in close collaboration with IT and Business dep.). Your key responsibilities will include:
 



  




* Data Strategy & Governance: Lead the local data strategy, align with business objectives, and implement a governance framework to ensure data quality, security, and compliance, acting as a liaison between IT and the business.
* Data Enablement & Management: Enable analytics, BI, AI, and data management; collaborate with IT to review, quality-check, govern, and prioritize data requests; oversee governance of business-managed IT applications in the C1-NE region; promote compliant data usage in BMW’s Cloud Data Hub and establish data stewardship.
* AI & Emerging Technologies: Stay current with new technologies (e.g., AI) to empower the organization.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Act as the primary interface between Business, IT, regional offices, and HQ; translate data needs from cross-functional stakeholders into actionable initiatives.
* Data Knowledge & Communication: Create training materials and communications to boost data literacy and accurate data interpretation.
* Continuous Improvement: Maintain documentation of processes within the role’s scope.



  





 What should you bring along?
 


* University Degree, with a major in Business, Information Technology, Data science or related field.
* Experience from Data analytics/Business intelligence, Data management, Data governance, or a similar role.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders (presentation to various stakeholders required).
* Good project management skills with ability to coordinate cross-functional initiatives.
* Good understanding of data and systems engineering concepts.
* Ideally Experience from Data Analytics/BI tools like Amazon QuickSight, Power BI, Tableau
* Experience working across various markets, in an international environment



  





 To succeed in this role, we believe you are:
 


* A data enthusiast who is ambitious, result-oriented and self-motivated.
* Structured, self-driven and proactive approach is very important: Like being able to independently set up and develop the role/ scope of work and carry out needed changes.
* Fluent in English and in one of the Nordic languages, beneficial with good skills in German.
* Strong and effective communicator - with stakeholder engagement abilities.
* Can manage high workload and can prioritize - ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment
* Committed to staying up-to-date with new technologies, trends, and advancements in data, AI, and related fields.



  





 What you can look forward to?
 



 Whatever your heart’s desire – in the BMW Group, you will find a wide range of departments and disciplines across the world where you can share your professional passion with us.
 



  





 This is a permanent position located in Sollentuna, the premises are modern and include a lunch restaurant as well as access to a gym and group training classes. If you find this interesting and you’re bringing the right mind-set in combination with a good skill set, please don’t hesitate to apply!
 



  





 At the BMW Group, we place great importance on equal treatment and equal opportunities. Our recruiting decisions are based on the personality, experience, and skills of the applicants.

title: It-support onsite till Kalmar
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care and Government Administration
description:
Som IT-supporttekniker hos oss blir du en viktig del i att hålla verksamheten igång. Du ser till att allt från datorer och mötesutrustning till nätverk och säkerhetslösningar fungerar smidigt – varje dag.
   

  

****Om tjänsten****
 I rollen som IT-supporttekniker hos oss arbetar du med att ge IT-support på plats på kontoret och säkerställa fungerande mötesutrustning. Du ansvarar för beställningar och funktionalitet kring mobiltelefoner, datorer, skrivare, kringutrustning och nätverk, i nära samarbete med vår driftleverantör. Rollen innebär också kontakt med olika leverantörer samt hantering av applikationer och installationspaketeringar.
   

  

 Du arbetar dessutom med passerkort/identifieringskort, beställningar av användarkonton och behörigheter samt andra säkerhetsrelaterade områden.
   

  

 Som IT-supporttekniker har du en självständig roll där du driver dina egna uppgifter, samtidigt som du samarbetar nära med kollegor på myndighetens huvudkontor i Kalmar och på kontoret i Stockholm. Du bygger också goda relationer med externa leverantörer och samarbetspartners.
   

  

 Arbetet utförs på E-hälsomyndighetens kontor i Kalmar.
   

  

****Om avdelningen****
 Avdelningen för Digital strategi och plattform ansvarar för att leverera stöd och styrning inom it-området till övriga avdelningar på myndigheten. Dessutom tillhandahåller avdelningen en väg in för externa intressenter att få support av myndighetens tjänster. Enheten Digital Arbetsplats är en del av avdelningen och kommer att arbeta med att utvecklas inom flera områden i verksamheten.
   

  

****Om dig****
 Vid rekryteringen lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper, då de är avgörande för hur du kommer att trivas och lyckas i rollen.Vi söker dig som är serviceinriktad och självgående, samtidigt som du är stabil och behåller lugnet i olika situationer. Du är flexibel när förutsättningar förändras och arbetar på ett strukturerat sätt för att nå resultat.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**
* eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet som arbetsgivare bedömer likvärdig
* aktuell erfarenhet av att ge användarsupport för mobiltelefoner iPhone
* aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta med datorer, hårdvara och mjukvara för PC på Windows, inklusive användarsupport för Officepaketet
* aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknisk support
* god kunskap i svenska, både i tal och i skrift.


**Det är meriterande för tjänsten om du har:**
* erfarenhet av att ge support och administrera inom Sharepoint
* erfarenhet av att arbeta inom Entra/Teams-administration och support
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med administration och support för Microsoft 365
* erfarenhet av att jobba i ett ärendehanteringssystem
* erfarenhet av att ge support och administrera Jira/Confluence.


****Vad erbjuder vi?****
 Vi är en myndighet i tillväxt. E-hälsomyndigheten erbjuder dig att vara med och skapa samhällsnytta. Vi arbetar med stora transaktionskritiska system som påverkar samhället, till exempel e-recept och Läkemedelskollen.
   

  

 Hos oss kommer du att omges av trevliga och kompetenta arbetskamrater, på en myndighet med ett flertal viktiga samhällsuppdrag.
   

  

 På E-hälsomyndigheten har alla medarbetare förtroendearbetstid och möjlighet att arbeta delvis på distans. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss: Jobba hos oss
   

  

****Är du intresserad?****
 Frågor angående tjänsten besvaras av:
   

  

 Enhetschef Maria Idberg: maria.idberg@ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Frågor angående rekryteringsprocessen besvaras av:
   

  

 HR-specialist Gabriela Plachecka: gabriela.plachecka@ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan och cv via vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den
 **24 oktober 2025** 
 . Ladda upp examensbevis, betyg och intyg som är relevanta för tjänsten i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

 Urvalsfrågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen.
 **Att besvara urvalsfrågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.** 
 Det är därför viktigt att du svarar tydligt och utförligt på urvalsfrågorna och inte hänvisar till andra handlingar t.ex. CV.
   

  

 På grund av arbetsuppgifternas karaktär behöver du i stor utsträckning vara på kontoret, och möjligheten att arbeta på distans är därför begränsad.
   

  

 Anställningen är tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Placeringsort för anställningen är
 **Kalmar** 
 . Arbetet kan innebära tjänsteresor, främst mellan Kalmar och Stockholm.
   

  

 Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs det svenkt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras innan anställningen påbörjas.
   

  

 Om du har beslut om skyddade personuppgifter, kontakta den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen.
   

  

****Om E-hälsomyndigheten****
 E-hälsomyndigheten driver utvecklingen av den nationella digitala infrastrukturen inom hälsa, vård och omsorg. Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar cirka 600 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens HR-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: Junior Buyer
description:
**Job Description**
 At ARKET, we believe that culture is the key to our success. As a Jr Buyer you actively support the senior buyer in driving growth, profitability and product development based on design direction and sales for our target customer in all sales channels. You actively support a Sr Buyer with daily tasks such as communication with our production offices, assortment planning, sample handling, placement and monitoring of orders, quantification of orders and wholesale administration. You take an active role in doing sales analysis, taking actions and follow-up. You will also be responsible for organizing fitting sessions.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Contribute to the product range based on visual goals, sales performance, growth potential, and profitability.
* Analyze sales and suggest actions based on insights.
* Participate in fitting sessions and manage sample handling processes.
* Maintain continuous contact with production offices regarding product development.
* Help the team meet timelines and keep deadlines.
* Place and follow up on orders.
* Support planning of quantities and budgets together with the Business Controller.
* Stay updated on trends, prices, and competitors, and share relevant findings.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You will collaborate closely with the Senior Buyer, Production offices and Business Controllers. You will also interact with Wholesale and other cross-functional teams to ensure a seamless product development and buying process. At ARKET, we work across organizational boundaries, sharing knowledge and supporting each other to create unbeatable customer value.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with
   

  

* Experience from retail and/or a buying position.
* Good English communication skills.
* Basic knowledge of materials and garment construction.
* A strong business sense and customer focus.
* Passion for fashion and trend analysis.


 And people who are
   

  

* Target-driven and takes initiative to drive things forward.
* Organized and structured, with the ability to prioritize and plan effectively.
* Flexible and solution-oriented in a fast-paced environment.
* Communicative and able to collaborate across teams.
* Motivated to grow within the role.
* Curious and open-minded, with a prestige-less attitude.
* Focused on creating value and delivering results.


 Additional Information
   

  

 This is a full time permanent position based at our Head Office in Södermalm Stockholm
   

  

 If you feel this opportunity is exciting feel free to apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible, but no later than the 5th of October. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 In this role you will have the flexibility to work both remotely and, from the office. While remote working is part of our offer, approx. 4 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and team work.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 ARKET is a modern-day market with a Nordic soul, offering a mix of fashion, homeware and a café while having quality, sustainability and transparency at the core of our business. ARKET’s mission is to democratise quality through widely accessible, well-made, durable products, designed to be used and loved for a long time. Learn more about ARKET here.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 We offer all our employees attractive benefits with broad development opportunities. All our employees receive a staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to this, ARKET-based colleagues also receive:
   

  

* 30 days holiday
* A collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal


 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you

title: Web Analyst (Nordics)
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights that drive digital growth? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where customer experience is at the heart of everything? We’re looking for a Web Analyst to join our Nordics E-commerce team in Region North Europe.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Web Analyst, you’ll play a key role in optimizing the customer journey on hm.com and the H&M app for our Nordic markets (SE, NO, DK, FI). Your insights will directly influence how we shape the digital experience, ensuring that we meet our customers’ needs and drive digital growth.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Analyse customer behaviour and site performance to identify opportunities that enhance the digital experience and drive sales.
* Follow up on strategies and actions, delivering actionable insights to the Digital team and cross-functional teams.
* Conduct full-funnel analysis, including traffic and internal search, to understand and improve the customer journey.
* Evaluate landing pages, traffic channels, and customer segments to optimize performance.
* Take lead in developing, implementing and setting best practice for new analytics tools and platforms to facilitate a data-driven way of working.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Join a collaborative Digital team, reporting to the E-commerce Commercial Manager for Nordics. You will work close with the Experience Lead and with E-commerce Leads, and partner with Regional Digital Controllers and cross-functional teams to unlock growth and profitability. You will also be a part of our global Web Analyst community.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* A university degree in Business, Economics, Data Science, or a related field
* 3+ years of experience in web and data analytics, ideally within a fast-paced e-commerce or digital retail environment.
* Strong business acumen with a proven track record of translating data into strategic actions that drive growth and customer experience improvements.
* Advanced proficiency in Power BI, Looker Studio, GCP, Excel and other relevant data visualization tools (e.g. Content Square) with beneficial experience in programming languages such as Big query, SQL, R, or Python as well as A/B testing experience.


 And people who are…
   

  

* Analytical thinkers with a strong commercial acumen, able to connect customer behaviour insights to business goals and influence decision-making across teams.
* Team-players who thrive in cross-functional environments, communicate clearly, and are passionate about driving growth and continuous improvement through data.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* 30 days holiday
* We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Benify Benefits Portal
* Community with activities


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm, with start date no later than January 31. Please send in your application as soon as possible. Simply attach your resume in English– no need for a cover letter.
   

  

 We don't offer any relocation assistance for this role.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Vi skapar förutsättningar för digitala tjänster och lösningar för privatpersoner och professioner inom hälso- och sjukvård, apotek och socialtjänst. Vi arbetar för att hälsodata ska bli tillgängliga i hela vårdkedjan, oavsett var individer får vård.
   

  

 Hos oss arbetar cirka 600 medarbetare fördelat på två orter, Kalmar och Stockholm. Läs mer om oss på www.ehalsomyndigheten.se
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av E-hälsomyndighetens HR-enhet och vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag och annonssäljare.

title: IT Manager – Business Application Domain
description:
**We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!**
*As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.*
**IT Manager – Business Applications**
 Location: Stockholm
   

  

**Own the Future of Business Applications at Arrive**
 Are you a seasoned IT leader who thrives on transformation, building trust across the business, and delivering real outcomes through technology?
   

  

 At
 **Arrive** 
 , we’re scaling fast—and we’re looking for an
 **IT Manager** 
 to lead our
 **Business Applications domain** 
 during a critical phase of growth. This is a
 **senior leadership role** 
 , ideal for someone who brings a rare blend of technical depth, operational insight, and human-centered leadership. If you've shaped IT delivery in
 **tech-driven or high-growth organizations** 
 , led application teams across
 **Customer Care, ERP, or Middleware** 
 , and know how to align business needs with IT execution—this could be your next move.
   

  

**What You’ll Lead And Deliver**
 Strategic Leadership & Transformation
   

  

* Own and drive the transformation of our SaaS application landscape to support scalable, efficient operations.
* Define and implement an effective IT delivery model—bridging the gap between business requirements and system execution.
* Build trust with business stakeholders, creating partnerships that encourage shared ownership—not just handover.


**Tech & Application Management**
* Lead a cross-functional team across Customer Care systems, ERP, and middleware applications, balancing operations and development.
* Maintain a dynamic 12-month roadmap focused on high-impact priorities and continuous improvement.
* Guide application lifecycle management, support models, and platform governance.


**Stakeholder & Relationship Building**
* Be the go-to leader who translates business goals into technical roadmaps and delivers them.
* Build meaningful relationships across functions, fostering empathy, collaboration, and a shared sense of purpose.
* Act as the senior escalation point for internal and external partners.


**Performance, Innovation & Growth**
* Define and track KPIs, SLAs, and OKRs aligned with strategic business outcomes.
* Champion innovation and automation within the business applications landscape.
* Lead retrospectives and feedback cycles to continuously evolve how we work and deliver.


**Governance, Risk & Compliance**
* Ensure applications and vendors meet compliance standards across security, data privacy, and audit readiness.
* Oversee vendor performance, contracts, and budget ownership.


**What You Bring**
* Senior IT leadership experience in business transformation, ideally in a tech, SaaS, or high-growth organization.
* Proven background managing Customer Care systems, ERP platforms or middleware - across both operations and development.
* Strong capability in translating complex business needs into actionable technical strategies.
* Deep understanding of enterprise SaaS, integration, and application governance models.
* Natural relationship-builder. Empathetic, curious, and trusted by stakeholders.
* A leader who takes ownership, builds delivery frameworks, and inspires others to do the same.


**Why Join Arrive?**
 At
 **Arrive** 
 , technology is not just a function—it’s a force for connection, scale, and progress. We’re creating the structures that will carry us into the next phase of our journey, and this role sits right at the heart of that mission.
   

  

**You’ll Join**
* A collaborative and ambitious team with the autonomy to shape your domain.
* A company where IT is seen as a strategic enabler, not just a service.
* A fast-paced environment where curiosity, accountability, and innovation are valued.


**About Us**
*Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.*
 Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

title: Media Analyst (Measurement & Attribution)
description:
**Job Description**
 We are seeking a
 **Media Analyst** 
 (Measurement & Attribution) to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This is a hands-on, insight-driven role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, media, and business impact. You’ll deliver actionable insights to global and regional marketing teams, helping optimize media investments and drive marketing effectiveness across channels.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Media Analyst, you will play a key role in how we measure and optimize the performance of our marketing efforts. Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Analyse media performance across channels by applying insights from advanced marketing analytics techniques such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Regression-Based Attribution (RBA), scenario modeling, and media mix evaluation.
* Generate actionable insights, recommend budget reallocations, and guide strategy adjustments to improve ROI and support growth.
* Build and present reports and dashboards that clearly communicate insights to global and regional stakeholders.
* Gather, organize, and validate data from multiple media sources, ensuring consistency and accuracy.
* Partner with regional marketing teams to support local implementation and ensure global consistency.
* Collaborate closely with the Attribution Lead to align on methodology, priorities, and the measurement roadmap, while contributing to a test-and-learn culture by continuously refining approaches based on performance insights.
* Work with cross-functional teams including media, CRM, strategy, finance, and technical product teams to embed insights into planning and execution.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Global Marketing function, collaborating with media operations, CRM, strategy and planning, controlling, technical product teams, and regional marketing teams. You’ll also work closely with the Attribution Lead to ensure insights drive measurable business impact.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for someone with...
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience in media analytics, preferably from a media agency, global retailer, or measurement supplier.
* Strong understanding of media KPIs and how to steer performance across digital channels.
* Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, attribution, or media mix modeling.
* Experience with tools such as GA4, Meta Ads Manager, Google Ads, and visualization platforms like Power BI or Looker Studio.
* Understanding of privacy-first innovation in measurement systems.
* Strong business acumen with the ability to connect insights to broader marketing and commercial objectives.
* Proactive team player with strong communication skills, able to simplify technical concepts and drive data-driven marketing in a global, fast-paced environment.
* Background in digital marketing or paid media is a strong plus, especially if combined with analytical capabilities.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.


**JOIN US**
 This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Local Product Manager - Gaming
description:
*Are you a passionate gamer with an interest in gaming hardware? Do you want to search for the incredible together with us?* 




  





 As a Product Manager at ASUS, you will have an integral part in ensuring that we stay on top of the gaming market. We dream, we dare and we strive to create an effortless and joyful digital life for everyone.
 



  





 ASUS Nordic is looking for a Local Product Manager based in Finland or Sweden. In this position you will be involved in developing the ASUS product portfolio within Gaming in the Nordic market. You will have the ownership of local customers’ P&L and plan and provide sales support for the entire product portfolio within Gaming Laptops and Desktops. ASUS is a fast-paced international business, where you will interact daily with our headquarters in Taiwan and with colleagues across the Nordic countries.
 



  





**About the team** 




 As a Local Product Manager at ASUS, you report directly to our Country Product Manager, who is based in Finland, and you will be a part of the Consumer PM and Operations team. You will find ROG marketing team, KAM team, Logistics and Backoffice team actively involved in your daily work. In addition, you will also work together with our HQ MDM team to deliver a solid offer to the Nordic market.
 



  





**Work tasks included, but not limited to:** 



* Initiate, plan, execute and follow up local product line-up strategy within responsibility area.
* Collecting market and competition information and conducting analysis.
* Manage the full life cycle of the line-up and plan Pan-Nordic and local campaigning.
* Execute and monitor the campaign plan for the segment, follow up the campaign result with analysis.
* Ownership of campaign budgeting, follow and control budget reservation and spending.
* Ownership within your customer group of their supply chain and run rate.
* Cross-department communication with Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, Product, and HQ team.
* Be a product expert of products within responsibility area for internal stakeholders.



  





**Skills** 



* A few years of experience in consumer electronics – either from a retailer or vendor side
* Previous role in Product Management, Category Management, or as a Product Specialist
* Strong skills in Excel and comfortable working with data
* Experience in setting up and executing campaigns



  





**On top of that we believe that you:** 



* Have a genuine interest in gaming and gaming hardware
* Like to set ambitious goals and work proactively to achieve them
* Are a quick learner who can apply new knowledge in a practical and flexible way
* Are a clear and confident communicator, able to collaborate across teams



  





**About the Position** 




**Scope:** 
 Full-time, permanent position with an initial 6-month probation period
 



**Start Date:** 
 By agreement
 



**Workplace:** 
 ASUS Nordic AB – Position is available in either Stockholm (Torshamnsgatan 35, 16440 Kista) or Helsinki (Kampinkuja 2, 00100 Helsinki)
 



  





**How To Apply** 




 Send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 24th of October. As we review applications on an ongoing basis, we encourage you to apply early. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English.
 



  





**About ASUS** 




 With over 35 years of experience in the tech industry, ASUS is a Taiwan-based, multinational computer hardware and consumer electronics company. Founded in 1989 as a motherboard manufacturer, ASUS components are found in the majority of computers worldwide. ASUS develops products across nearly all IT-related areas, including laptops, desktops, all-in-one PCs, tablets, smartphones, smartwatches, computer components, monitors, multimedia products, servers, networking equipment, and even home robots—dedicated to creating products for today’s and tomorrow’s smart life. Today, ASUS is the world’s No. 1 motherboard and gaming brand as well as a top-three consumer notebook vendor.
 



  





 ASUS currently employs more than 17,000 people globally, including 98 employees in the Nordics.
 



 https://www.asus.com/se/

title: Co-Founder
description:
**Company Description** 





 Zoometry is an AgTech startup on a mission to accelerate innovation in animal feed through data. We are developing the first end-to-end SaaS platform that centralizes, simplifies, and analyzes data from animal nutrition and health trials. Our north star is to empower our customers to develop more effective and sustainable health solutions, faster.
 




  





**Role Description** 





 As our Co-founder, CTO, you'll build and lead the entire technological vision and execution for Zoometry. You'll be at the core of creating our platform and establishing our technical culture.
 




  






 You'll be responsible for:
 



* Building Tech Infrastructure: Design, develop, and manage Zoometry's core platform, tech stack, databases, and cloud architecture.
* Leading Development: Drive the full software development lifecycle from concept to deployment.
* And much more... (it's the startup adventure! 🙂)



  





**Qualifications** 





 This Co-founder role is ideal for a hands-on technical leader with an entrepreneurial spirit, with:
 




  




* Solid expertise in building full-stack software
* Strong skills in system design, APIs, and data management
* Excited about AI integration and practical applications
* Proactive, self-motivated, and collaborative team player
