* Keen interest in the AgTech field – this would be a fantastic plus.



  






 The role can be based in
 
**Stockholm** 

 or
 
**remote** 

 (with a preference for France)
 




  





**How to Apply** 





 Send an email with your CV to contact@zoometry.fr.
 




  






 PS: We are always happy to hear from diverse profiles and interests, so please feel free to reach out to us!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Assignment description:** 




  





  





**Assignment start date: 2025-10-13** 




**Assignment end date: 2026-06-30** 




**Workload: 100%** 




**Percentage of remote work allowed: 40%** 




**Client: Retail** 




**Location: Stockholm** 




  





  





**Data Engineer - Job Description:** 




  





  




* You will be involved in one of the biggest data transformation journey.
* As a data engineer, you will be working with building of data products in the context of Data Mesh concept based on defined target vision and requirements.
* We appreciate a multitude of technical backgrounds, and we believe you will enjoy working here if you are passionate about data.
* In this role, you will be required to implement data-intensive solutions for a data-driven organization.
* You will join the Data Engineering Competence area within AI (Artificial Intelligence), Analytics & Data Domain and be an individual contributor in one of the data product-teams.
* The area supports all our brands globally to create, structure, guard and ensure data is available, understandable and of high quality.











**Responsibilities:** 




  





  




* Take end-to-end responsibility to build, optimize and support of existing and new data products towards the defined target vision
* Be a champion of DevOps mindset and principles and able to manage CI/CD pipelines and terraform as well as Cloud infrastructure, in our context, it is GCP (Google Cloud Platform).
* Ensure that our built data products work as independent units of deployment and non-functional aspects of the data products follow the defined standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
* Work close to the Product Manager and other stakeholders around vision for existing data products and identifying new data products to support our customer needs
* Work with product teams within and outside our domain around topics that relate to the data mesh concept.
* Evaluate and drive continuous improvement and reducing technical debt in the teams
* Maintain expertise in latest data/analytics and cloud technologies











**Qualifications:** 




  





  




* Competence level: Senior or Expert. Minimum 6+ years of experience.
* At least 4+ years' hands-on work experience as Data engineer on GCP/modern cloud data platforms, or advanced analytics environments.
* Experience in cloud technologies and infrastructure
* Experience in GCP tools – BigQuery, Cloud Functions, Pubsub, etc.
* Experience in different data formats (Parquet, Avro)
* Experience in data query languages (SQL or similar)
* Experience in data centric programming using one of more programming languages (Python, Java or Scala)
* Knowledge of NoSQL and RDBMS databases



  









**Required cloud certification: GCP:** 




  




* Consultant is expected to have certificate at latest 1 month after start, if not already certified.











**If interested, or you know someone that could be, please reach out and we can arrange a time to speak?**

title: Engineering Manager to Software Engineering
description:
*At NOBA Bank Group, we are unlocking new possibilities as we enter an exciting phase with great untapped potential! As the Engineering Manager for one of our Software Engineering teams, you will play a crucial role in both leading daily deliveries and engaging in strategic discussions with Product and Technology leadership. This is your opportunity to shape our technology landscape and create real business impact.*
**About the role:**
 We are looking for an
 **Engineering Manager** 
 to join our Software Engineering department in Stockholm. You will lead a team of 5 engineers responsible for customer onboarding for our Nordax brand, specializing in secure loans. Working closely with the Product Owner and Head of Tech Nordax, you will drive your team’s deliveries while staying engaged with the technical direction and decisions related to software development
   

  

 As Engineering Manager, you will work across the full stack, developing new web services, improving system usability, and maintaining existing solutions. This role is perfect for someone with strong technical skills who wants to stay close to software development while also mentoring and leading a team.
   

  

**Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**
* Leadership & coaching – Guide, mentor, and support your team members.
* Cross-team collaboration – Drive initiatives across multiple teams and domains.
* Business impact – Ensure business objectives are met and project deadlines are achieved.
* Technical leadership - Support your team making technical decisions as responsible for your teams deliveries
* Process improvement – Uphold and refine development best practices and ways of working.
* Recruitment & growth – Help build and strengthen the Software Engineering organization by hiring top talent.


**We are looking for you who:**
 Enjoys leading and supporting others, while staying involved in technical development. You are curious, engaged, and always looking for ways to improve both your own skills and those of your team. You also value close collaboration with fellow Engineering Managers to align and enhance ways of working across teams. For this role you’ll need:
   

  

* 7+ years of experience in software development with C#/.NET/.NET Core.
* 3+ years of experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (preferably React).
* 2+ years of formal leadership experience.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft’s development stack and lifecycle tools.
* Experience working with SQL.
* Fluency in English (written & spoken).
* Experience in hiring, goal-setting, coaching, and performance reviews.


**It’s a plus if you have:**
* Public cloud platforms (preferably Azure).
* Test-driven development (TDD) or similar methodologies.
* Continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment (CI/CD).
* Scrum Master responsibilities.
* Fluency in Swedish.


**Our offer to you:**
* Freedom with responsibility
* Career Development
* Feedback Culture
* Coaching Leadership
* A strong caring company culture – we really care about each other!


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.
   

  

**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer
description:
Nordnet is a leading pan-Nordic digital platform for savings and investments. Ever since we started in 1996, our purpose has been to democratize savings and investments. Through innovation, simplicity, and transparency, we challenge traditional ways in the financial industry, and give private savers access to the same information, tools and services as professionals. Our ambition is to inspire, encourage and enable people to take their savings to the next level, no matter who they are.
   

  

*Help us transform the way people save and invest. Become a part of journey to build an inspiring and innovative platform for savers and investors in the Nordics. Here's your opportunity!*
**In brief**
 We are looking for a Senior Windows/Mac Client & System Engineer to join Nordnets IT Support department. We currently have 5 engineers working in the team and are now looking for one more, with mainly Windows competence.
   

  

 IT Support's mission is twofolded
   

  

* Provide prompt and effective assistance to Nordnet personnel with IT equipment and software-related inquiries and issues.
* Proactively maintain the integrity, functionality, and security of client devices, mobile phones, meeting room equipment, and associated software, ensuring adherence to Nordnet's stringent security standards.


 IT Operations is comprised of various teams, and you will collaborate closely with them to effectively manage problems and drive progress on ongoing initiatives and projects.
   

  

**This is you**
 Most likely, you have a technical background that enables you to understand IT services on a deeper level. You have a strong passion for customer satisfaction. You like to communicate, and you have a true interest in building relations and creating result through your team.
   

  

 You should have several years of experience working with Clients (Mac/Win & Mobiles).
   

  

 Good knowledge of
   

  

* SCCM
* Intune
* Azure
* Jamf
* Google workspace


 You have an open mindset and a can-do attitude. Getting to know the details and understanding how everything is connected and dependent on each other is of great importance to you. You’re not afraid of rolling up your sleeves and love working in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Client OS Configuration and deployment of Clients (Win/Mac & Mobile).
* Provide technical support to users and troubleshoot problems related to these clients.
* Deploy and manage software updates
* Troubleshoot hardware and software problems
* Document system configurations and procedures


 Former experience within Client OS Configuration is considered a huge advantage.
   

  

**About Nordnetters**
 We value experimentation and continuous improvement. With an impartial approach, we welcome new ideas to boost our progress. Sharing knowledge and learning from our setbacks is part of the game. We have the courage to ask questions and admit that we do not have the answer, all the time. We believe that straightforward and transparent communication build trust and inclusion.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer you the opportunity to work in a great team within a friendly Nordic environment with a strong focus on innovation, product development and technology. We are proud of the friendly and humble environment and commit to our goals as a team.
   

  

 We are 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 You can also visit us on: www.nordnet.se, www.nordnet.no, www.nordnet.dk and www.nordnet.fi.
   

  

**Application**
 If you have questions, please contact Head of IT-Support, Patrik Axelsson, patrik.axelsson@nordnet.se
   

  

 Apply today– Due to summer vacation we will start to review applications in the beginning of August and will get back to you with feedback as soon as possible. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Audio Visual Technician
description:
Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future ready, sustainable businesses. With over 230,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our customers, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world. For additional information, visit us at www.wipro.com
 



  





**About the Role:** 




  





 The Onsite & Dispatch Support team plays a key role in providing exceptional first-level support for client’s diverse technical environment. While the primary focus is on digital-first support, occasional onsite presence at client locations worldwide is required. The team ensures quick resolutions to IT service issues, supporting both resident and dispatch technicians who manage incident tickets and offer in-person assistance.
 



  





**Quantum Support Services** 




  





**What you need to have:** 




  




* Resident Technicians: expertise in AV systems, hardware support, and network troubleshooting.
* Dispatch Technicians: capable of troubleshooting diverse technical issues across locations.
* Experience with troubleshooting and managing AV systems (Crestron, Extron, Teams Rooms).
* Strong understanding of quantum computing and research environments.
* Proficient in hardware and peripheral management.
* Ability to coordinate and troubleshoot within a research setting.
* Quantum Support: Monday to Friday, 9 AM to 5 PM (local time) at research hubs.



  





**What you will do:** 




  




* We have to work during local business hours of that specific location. Expertise on local language with English written and communication expertise
* Strong communication skills, with a customer-focused approach to resolving issues.
* Ability to adapt to evolving environments, displaying flexibility and innovation in service delivery.
* Provide first-level onsite support for hardware, AV systems, device management, and basic networking.
* Act as the primary point of contact for onsite support, including issue registration, classification, and restoration of failed IT services.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure seamless ticket dispatch and support across various service areas.
* Exhibit superior customer service by effectively communicating and assisting clients, while promoting a positive user experience.
* Manage and troubleshoot Microsoft devices, AV setups (Extron, Crestron), and conference room equipment, ensuring functionality during events.
* Contribute to AV event support, assisting with setup, troubleshooting, and post-event shutdown.
* Maintain inventory of devices, spare parts, and equipment, ensuring timely replacements and repairs.
* Certifications: CompTIA A+, CTS (Certified Technology Specialist), Azure Fundamentals, or equivalent.



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Provide onsite support at client research hubs (5 global locations).
* Offer support 4 hours per week during local business hours at each site.
* Manage peripheral stock (mice, keyboards, monitors) for the research hubs.
* Ensure availability of peripheral stock through business administrators.



  





  





**Equal Opportunity Employer:** 




  





 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, marital status, age, ethnic and national origin, sexual and political orientation and disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Tekniker / Driftsättare inom säkerhets-/kommunikationstekniksättare
description:
**Om oss** 




 Commend Nordic är en del av Commend-gruppen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Vi levererar avancerade intercom- och säkerhetslösningar över hela Norden, integrerar röst, bild och data i kritiska miljöer och fokuserar starkt på IT-säkerhet och tillförlitlighet.
 



  





 Commend International, med bas i Salzburg, Österrike, utvecklar och tillverkar våra produkter. Med över 50 års erfarenhet är Commend en global ledare inom säker kommunikation och lösningar för krävande miljöer.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter & ansvarsområden** 




 Vi söker nu en engagerad och tekniskt kompetent kollega som vill vara med och driva våra leveranser och support i Norden.
 



  





 - Driftsättning och konfiguration av våra system hos kunder i olika länder i Norden
 



 - Felsökning, service och teknisk support vid driftproblem
 



 - Second line-support via telefon till kunder och partners
 



 - Dokumentation och rapportering enligt fastställda standarder
 



 - Delta i projekt, samarbeta med säljare, projektledare och andra tekniker
 



 - Vid behov resa till kundplatser inom Norden (upp till ca 20 dagar per år)
 



 - Genomgå bakgrundskontroll för att få tillträde till säkerhetsklassade miljöer
 



  





**Kvalifikationer & krav** 




 - Teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
 



 - Erfarenhet som tekniker, gärna från säkerhets-, kommunikations- eller teknikinfrastrukturbranschen
 



 - God förmåga att läsa ritningar, förstå nätverk, protokoll och integrationer
 



 - Självgående och strukturerad, med god kommunikationsförmåga
 



 - Flexibel och van att resa inom Norden (ca 20 dagar/år)
 



 - Måste kunna passera bakgrundskontroll
 



 - B-körkort (krav för tjänstebil)
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 - Tjänstebil
 



 - Konkurrenskraftig lön och goda villkor
 



 - Möjlighet att arbeta med högteknologiska lösningar och växande marknad
 



 - Ett engagerat team med tekniskt driv och fokus på kvalitet
 



 - Stöd och utveckling inom företaget
 







**Så här söker du** 




 Vänligen skicka ditt CV direkt till l.bergstrand@commend.se.
 



**Lars & Magnus** 
 kommer att intervjua sökande löpande.

title: Data Privacy Lead
description:
**Job Description**
 WHAT YOU’LL DO
   

  

 The Data Privacy Lead is overall responsible for managing privacy compliance within in the region (UK, Ireland, Sweden, Demark, Norway, Iceland, Finland). For this role your responsibilities include but are not limited to:
   

  

 OWNERSHIP & COMPLIANCE – Ensure data privacy compliance across the Region in alignment with global privacy frameworks. Stay updated on local regulations and practices and translate them into pragmatic regional processes, guidelines and best practices.
   

  

 AWARENESS & TRAINING – Drive awareness and build data privacy competence across the Region. Collaborate with Regional Management and local teams to embed a strong compliance culture and coordinate relevant training and support.
   

  

 BUSINESS SUPPORT – Provide hands-on guidance on new or evolving uses of personal data. Proactively support business plans by identifying data privacy needs and ensuring solutions align with both compliance and business goals.
   

  

 CONTROL & FOLLOW-UP – Identify and prioritize risks and set risk-based action plans to close compliance gaps. Lead breach management in coordination with the central data privacy team, and report to key stakeholders. Support with audits and reviews.
   

  

 COLLABORATION & CONTACTS – Act as the main contact for regional privacy matters. Maintain strong internal and external relationships, including with local authorities, in partnership with the central data privacy team.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 The Data Privacy Lead will work closely with key functions across the region, including Legal, HR, IT, Marketing, Store Operations, and E-commerce, to ensure compliant handling of personal data and support privacy-by-design practices.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with
   

  

* Law Degree
* At least 4 years working experience within same or similar field


 And people who have
   

  

* Profound updated knowledge and experience of GDPR and relevant regional data protection legislation and legal compliance
* Strong business acumen with a pragmatic mindset and ability to prioritize and manage risk.
* Great cooperation and communication skills. Having the ability to make the complex simple and able to communicate and engage at all levels as well as with both formal and informal stakeholders
* Strategical, abstract and conceptual thinking ability with a flexible mindset and the ability to see, formulate and propose different solutions in a way that are easy to understand for others
* Ability to identify and recognize opportunities for new or improved technologies to enable a more effective data protection compliance function and improvements
* Curious by nature and interested in learning and developing yourself within your area of expertise
* Great interpersonal skills and ability to work well both independently and as part of a team


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

 WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE
   

  

 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 JOIN US
   

  

 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, apply by sending your application through the career site as soon as possible but no later than October 8th, 2025.
   

  

 This is a permanent position. The position is based in our Regional office in Stockholm and reports to Regional Legal Counsel.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Specialist IT & kommunikationsteknik till Ersta diakoni
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vi bedriver sjukvård, socialt arbete, forskning och utbildning, professionellt och utan vinstsyfte.
   

  

 Som IT- och mediateknikspecialist kommer du tillhöra IT-avdelningen som ansvarar för en stabil, modern och användarvänlig teknisk miljö för hela verksamheten. Här arbetar vi nära sjukvården, äldreomsorgen, LSS-verksamheter och våra övriga enheter – alltid med målet att tekniken ska stötta vardagen för både medarbetare och patienter/brukare.
   

  

 Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som vi hoppas ska ge dig förutsättningar att trivas på jobbet och ha en givande fritid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I den här rollen kommer du att:
   

  

* Vara tekniskt ansvarig för visningsskärmar, digitala informationsytor och konferenssystem
* Säkerställa drift och utveckling av telefoner, iPads och annan mobil utrustning
* Ansvara för vårt TV-utbud och se till att det fungerar på ett tillförlitligt och användarvänligt sätt i verksamheten
* Arbeta med media- och presentationsteknik i våra mötesrum och publika miljöer
* Ha en aktiv dialog med leverantörer kring avtal, support och utveckling
* Ge stöd och vägledning i mer komplexa ärenden och agera expert för kollegor och verksamheten
* Bidra till utveckling av lösningar inom kommunikation och användarnära/-vänlig teknik
* Delta i projekt och initiativ kopplat till exempelvis digitala mötesmiljöer, hybridmöten och verksamhetsnära digitalisering.


**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken på teknikens möjligheter i vårdmiljöer. Du har förmåga att självständigt driva ditt område framåt, ser helheten och värnar samtidigt om detaljerna som gör skillnad för användarna.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du vara strukturerad, lösningsorienterad och serviceinriktad. Du trivs med att ta ansvar för ett teknikområde och gillar att arbeta både självständigt och i samarbete med kollegor.
   

  

 Du möter användare på ett ödmjukt och pedagogiskt sätt, oavsett deras tekniska vana, och du har en framåtlutad inställning till hur teknik kan stötta vård, äldreomsorg och våra stödenheter.
   

  

 Du delar Erstas värdegrund om att se hela människan och våra värdeord; professionalism, tillit och hopp.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av konferensteknik, visningsskärmar, TV-lösningar och/eller AV-system
* Erfarenhet av IT-infrastruktur och förståelse för hur systemen hänger ihop
* Kunskap kring administration och hantering av mobila enheter (telefoner och surfplattor).


 Meriterande är om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av vård, omsorg eller annan samhällsnära verksamhet
* Praktisk erfarenhet av hybridmöten, streaminglösningar eller digital skyltning
* Erfarenhet av leverantörsdialog och upphandling.


**Övrigt om rekryteringen**
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning som standard.
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Robert Rangdag, Chef IT-Support, Tjänsteägare Klient och ID, robert.rangdag@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Facklig kontaktperson: Fiona Cameron, SACO, fiona.cameron@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 2025-10-19
   

  

*Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.*
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Business/Data Analyst
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll* 
*.*
 Din roll
   

  

 Stategy & BI är en avdelning inom Saabs produktion i Järfälla. Vi arbetar med att identifiera, designa, bygga, realisera och implementera verksamhetsutveckling både inom arbetssätt och tekniska lösningar. Vi står inför en stor tillväxt och behöver accelerera transformationsarbetet ytterligare. Vi söker därför efter en Business/Data Analyst.
   

  

 Som Business/Data Analyst inom produktionen på Saab kommer du att vara en central del av vårt Strategy & Business Intelligence -team som strävar efter att förbättra produktion genom användning av dataanalys och insikter. Du kommer att samla in, analysera och tolka data för att identifiera mönster, trender och potentiella förbättringsområden inom vår produktion. Vidare kommer du att bygga tekniska lösningar med hjälp av olika verktyg och plattformar samt tillsammans med teamet bidra till att implementera dessa. Gruppen du kommer att tillhöra är högpresterande personer som jobbar i sprintar. Hos oss är det högt i tak, vi har kul tillsammans och sätter vikt vid att leverera på högsta förmåga med snabb framdrift. Vi strävar efter att samarbeta i olika konstellationer och på så vis lära av varandra.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Självständigt driva strategiska tranformationsprojekt
* Analysera produktionsdata och identifiera trender, mönster och förbättringsområden.
* Arbeta nära den operativa verksamheten för att få en djup förståelse kring prestanda och behov samt identifiera och implementera förbättringar.
* Initiera, leda eller delta i verksamhetsutvecklande projekt, verktyg, tekniska lösningar och strategiarbete.
* Kommunicera resultat av analyser, insikter och rekommendationer.
* Aktivt söka inspiration, kunskap och best practice intern och extern samt förmåga att omsätta det till verksamheten


 Din profil
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid din förmåga att jobba i grupp samtidigt som du självständigt kan driva dina uppgifter framåt. Du kommer med innovativa lösningar, är driven och proaktiv. Tjänsten medför samarbete med alla delar av Saabs produktion, affärsenheten och affärsområdets övriga verksamhet, varför vi sätter stort värde vid din kommunikativa förmåga. Då vi är i en tillväxtfas är det av stor vikt att du gillar att jobba i och leda förändring samt är en ambassadör för en framåtlutad anda.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Högskoleexamen inom maskinteknik, datavetenskap, industriell ekonomi eller liknande område.
* Erfarenhet av affärsanalys, processförbättring, förändringsledning och verksamhetsutveckling inom produktionsmiljö.
* Kompetens inom ett eller flera områden inom Machine Learning, Prediktiv analys, Avancerad analys och Digital automation
* Starka analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att tolka och extrahera insikter från komplexa dataset.
* God förståelse för producerande verksamhet, tillverkningsstrategi, internlogistik, produktionsteknik, industrialisering och affärsdrivande faktorer.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter och förmåga att samarbeta med olika intressenter.
* Pratar flytande svenska och kommunicerar obehindrat på engelska.
* Minst fem års erfarenhet inom tillverkande industri.


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* IFS eller annat ERP-system.
* IT service (t.ex. Service Now)
* Erfarenhet av olika typer av databaser, samt hantering, städning och manipulering av stora datamängder
* Erfarenhet av programmering (ex. SQL, Python) och datavisualisering (ex. Qliksense, Power BI, eller Grafana).
* Plattformar för processautomatisering (t.ex. Camunda eller Blue Prism)
* Erfarenhet av MES (t.ex. FactoryLogix)
* AI-assistenter (implementerings-process och business adoption)


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Upptäck oändliga möjligheter. Anta utmaningar, skapa smarta innovationer och uppgradera dina förmågor. Det här är en plats för kluriga tänkare, modiga pionjärer och alla däremellan. Tillsammans uppnår vi det extraordinära, var och en tar med sitt unika perspektiv. Varje bidrag räknas.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 26,100 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Ericsson are technology leaders that create ground-breaking technology, conceived, built and delivered to make people’s lives easier, more fulfilling and connected. To imagine the possible and work with the latest technology of today and tomorrow, we are looking for the next generation in Tech.
   

  

 We are on a mission to ensure Ericsson is making the best use of data as possible. Right now, we're seeking a newly graduated Data Engineer to continue our exciting journey ahead.
   

  

 You will be a part of the Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence team in the Production system for our Radio Unit Software sector. Our mission is to enable our production applications with data and AI. We empower people and machines with insights based on large amounts of data from development environments, labs, and Ericsson products in live customer’s networks.
   

  

 The area of data and AI is constantly evolving, and you will be working with pioneering commercial and open source tools to accomplish our mission.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 As a Data Engineer you will join a group of skilled software engineers, data engineers and data scientists. You will have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Work in a team to enable usage of data within Ericsson.
* Ensure that the data is securely ingested to the data lake.
* Prepare, transform, enrich, and improve quality of the data to make it available for consumption.
* Create our data Platform, to ensure that we have data with high quality and high availability.
* Work closely with data consumers and make sure that their specific data needs are met.
* Provide valuable and concrete insights using data and/or graphical user interfaces.


**The skills you bring:**
 Your personal qualities are important for us, and we believe you are curious, innovative, collaborative, and have an eagerness to learn new technologies. As part of NextGen we are seeking for 1 new colleague who wish to explore their career with us, and who is newly graduated or have a maximum 2-3 years of relevant experience.
   

  

 In addition, we believe you have:
   

  

* A BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or equivalent.
* Passion for data engineering, problem-solving, and data analytics.
* Knowledge of Python.
* Understanding of containerization and infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes, Linux.
* Exposure to message buses (Kafka, RabbitMQ).
* Familiarity with data storages/databases (ElasticSearch/OpenSearch, S3, MongoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL).
* Experience with development tools (Gitlab, Gerrit, Jira).
* Basic knowledge of observability tools (Grafana, Kibana, OpenTelemetry).
* Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
* It is considered a plus if you have experience with workflow orchestration tools (Airflow, Argo, Jenkins), big data technologies, and cloud platforms like AWS.
* It is also a merit if you have knowledge of frontend development (Node.js, React.js), IT security, and UX/UI best practices.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 773659

title: Cybersäkerhetsspecialist
description:
**För En Hållbar Framtid Tillsammans**
 Coop är Sveriges största kooperation och en ledande aktör inom dagligvaruhandeln, med över 4 miljoner medlemmar. Vi har ett stort fokus på hållbarhet och arbetar för att skapa en mer grön och rättvis framtid genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster.
   

  

 Vi tror på att en mångfald av perspektiv och erfarenheter är nyckeln till att skapa en mer inkluderande och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Därför välkomnar vi alla oavsett kön, ålder, bakgrund och etnisk tillhörighet.
   

  

**Bli en del av Coop – Tillsammans gör vi mat-Sverige hållbart!**
**Om Tjänsten**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens hållbara dagligvaruhandel? Som
 **Cybersäkerhetsspecialist hos Coop Sverige** 
 får du möjlighet att driva våra viktiga förflyttningar och bidra till vårt viktiga arbete för en mer hållbar framtid, samtidigt som du stärker vår digitala motståndskraft.
   

  

 Som
 **Cybersäkerhetsspecialist** 
 blir du en nyckelperson i att höja säkerhetsnivån, stötta verksamheten och agera rådgivare i strategiska till operativa frågor. Du kommer arbeta brett, från riskanalyser och kravställning till att leda initiativ, incidenthantering och implementering av säkerhetslösningar. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med hela organisationen, externa leverantörer samt informationssäkerhetsteamet. Teamet består i dagsläget av två experter inom området.
   

  

**I Rollen Kommer Du Att Jobba Med**
* Driva och delta i initiativ för att höja organisationens IT- och cybersäkerhet.
* Stötta projekt och utvecklingsinitiativ utifrån ett säkerhetsperspektiv, exempelvis vid upphandlingar och utredningar.
* Genomföra riskarbete, identifiera och följa upp sårbarheter samt vid behov leda och hantera säkerhetsincidenter.
* Utveckla metoder, processer och arbetssätt inom cybersäkerhet.
* Fungera som bryggan mellan teknik och verksamhet genom att kommunicera och skapa förståelse för säkerhetsfrågor.
* Bidra till kunskapshöjande insatser inom organisationen.
* Delta i avdelningens övriga arbete och bidra till teamets utveckling.


***Vem är du?***
 Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk förståelse och förmåga att driva och leda arbetet med cybersäkerhet på ett självständigt sätt. Du är trygg i din kompetens och kan på ett professionellt och övertygande sätt stå fast vid dina rekommendationer, samtidigt som du är prestigelös och serviceinriktad.
   

  

 Du är kommunikativ och pedagogisk, och finner det naturligt att förklara komplexa frågor och skapa engagemang hos olika målgrupper. Du trivs med att kombinera strategiskt arbete med operativa insatser och är van vid att samarbeta med intressenter på flera nivåer i organisationen.
   

  

* För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi gärna att du har:
* 3–5 års erfarenhet inom cybersäkerhet eller IT-säkerhet.
* Kunskap inom tekniska områden som publika moln, servrar, brandväggar, nätverk, autentisering och drift av IT-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av riskanalys, incidenthantering och kravställning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa miljöer, gärna med outsourcad IT-leverans och externa partners.
* Relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning, exempelvis inom IT, information- eller cybersäkerhet.
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.


**Meriterande**
* Certifieringar inom området, exempelvis CISSP eller ISO/IEC 27001.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av operativt säkerhetsarbete och förståelse för hotlandskapet.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som projektledare eller kravställare i säkerhetsrelaterade initiativ.
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändrings- och förbättringsarbete.


**Vårt Erbjudande Till Dig**
 Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats där du får möjlighet att växa och utvecklas i en inkluderande och inspirerande kultur. Hos oss på Coop får du vara en del av ett engagerat team och bidra till en mer hållbar framtid. Vi erbjuder även konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, flexibel arbetstid och en god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Så Ansöker Du**
 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, senast 2025-11-09, då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Andreas Nilsson på e-postadress: andreas.nilsson2@coop.se

title: Senior Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 H&M is on a journey to meet and exceed our customers' expectations today and tomorrow. Through collaboration, innovation, and technology, we challenge ourselves and the industry. To cater to the individual needs and desires of our millions of customers, our tech organization delivers solutions for the entire value chain for all our brands.
   

  

 As a Platform Engineer within our AI, Analytics & Data department, you will:
   

  

 → Design, develop, and manage scalable data platforms on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
   

  

 → Implement and manage infrastructure as code using Terraform
   

  

 → Automate deployment processes using GitHub Actions
   

  

 → Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and engineers to ensure data availability and quality
   

  

 → Monitor and optimize data pipelines for performance and cost-efficiency
   

  

 → Ensure data security and compliance with relevant regulations
   

  

 → Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data infrastructure
   

  

 → Work in an internationally agile-driven environment on solutions used across the globe
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of the AI, Analytics & Data department; a dynamic and innovative team at the cutting edge of data-driven decision-making. We leverage advanced analytics, AI, and machine learning to tackle complex challenges and drive business growth. You’ll collaborate with passionate technologists and leaders who are driving the digital transformation of H&M.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
 → Equivalent hands-on experience in a similar technical role or a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
   

  

 → Strong expertise in GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Workflows, Pub/Sub, Dataflow, etc.)
   

  

 → Experience with CI/CD tools, particularly GitHub Actions
   

  

 → Experience with dbt for data transformation
   

  

 → Solid understanding of DevOps principles and practices
   

  

 → Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or similar languages
   

  

*And people who are:*
 → Proactive and self-driven, with the ability to take full ownership of initiatives
   

  

 → Excellent problem-solvers with attention to detail
   

  

 → Strong communicators and collaborators
   

  

 → Comfortable working independently and as part of a team
   

  

**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 → A tech-driven environment with cutting-edge tools and platforms
   

  

 → Opportunities to grow and shape the future of data and AI at H&M
   

  

 → A collaborative culture that values innovation, inclusion, and continuous learning
   

  

 → All our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program (HIP)
   

  

 → All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound
   

  

**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things: our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*
 Resources needed: 2

title: Junior Data Quality & BI specialist
description:
**Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? På PwC tror vi på att använda våra olika perspektiv för att tillsammans utveckla morgondagens företag och organisationer. Vi har en gemensam målsättning att vara med och bygga något större än oss själva genom att skapa förtroende, positiv förändring och långsiktigt hållbara värden. Är du redo att utforska nya karriärmöjligheter hos oss?**
 Vi söker en Junior Data Quality & BI specialist till vårt CDO Office som vill vara med och bidra till att PwC arbetar effektivt, agilt och teknikdrivet med data.
   

  

 För PwC är det både strategiskt, taktiskt och operationellt viktig att vi hanterar all vår data med kvalitet, säkerhet och att vi uppfyller regulatoriska krav. Inom PwC finns det gemensamma processer för hantering av data och det pågår flera spännande initiativ gällande just data management i hela nätverket.
   

  

**Är du vår nya kollega inom Data Quality?**
 I din roll kommer du att arbeta med data management såväl som datakvalitet och analys. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för att validera/monitorera data samt identifiera områden där vi kan bli bättre. Vidare kommer du att ha ett nära samarbete med andra interna avdelningar kring den information som dagligen används i våra affärsprocesser.
   

  

 Vårt team ingår i flera stora projekt vilket innebär att du kommer att få vara med på flera delar av den förändringsresa vi befinner oss på, allt från att systematisera och upprätthålla datakvalitet, utforska möjligheter till automatisering, implementering av agenter i PwC:s interna processer samt att stötta verksamheten i de nya datadrivna processer som tas fram.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga uppgifter**
 Du Är, Tillsammans Med Teamet, En Nyckelperson i Vårt Löpande Arbete Kring Datakvalitet. Du Ansvarar För Löpande Validering/monitorering Av Data Och Bidrar Med Analyser. Du Identifierar Områden Där Vi Kan Förbättra Datakvalitet Och/eller Stödjande Processer. Några Av Dina Huvudsakliga Uppgifter Är
   

  

* Validera/monitorera datakvalitet och arbeta för att förbättra denna
* Bidra till automatisering av nuvarande och framtida processer
* Ta fram rapporter och analysera data till olika stakeholders inom organisationen.


**Vi söker dig som**
 Vi ser gärna att du har en akademisk examen. Du har antingen arbetat i en liknande roll tidigare alternativt tagit din examen och är redo för att börja din karriär hos oss.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper för den här rollen. Du har ett intresse för dataanalys samt digitalisering/automatisering och trivs i en roll som har potential att utvecklas över tid. Vi tror att du har god förmåga att samarbeta, är kommunikativ, serviceinriktad och har ett noggrant fokus på detaljer. Andra egenskaper som vi värdesätter är förmågan att organisera dina arbetsuppgifter och arbeta strukturerat. Du är också nyfiken samt trivs i en föränderlig och internationell arbetsmiljö.
   

  

**Vidare Ser Vi Följande Kvalifikationer**
* Har universitets-, eller högskoleutbildning, gärna inom data, IT eller motsvarande.
* Erfaranhet av PowerBI, Alteryx, PowerAutomate eller liknande är meriterande.
* Goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska.


 ,
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vi kommer att gå igenom ansökningarna löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas tidigare än sista ansökningsdagen.
   

  

**Vi ber dig bifoga följande handlingar med din ansökan:**
* CV
* Personligt brev


 Vi tror på möjligheterna i att ha en rekryteringsprocess som gäller för alla. Som en del av urvalet använder vi oss därför av arbetspsykologiska tester med syfte att säkerställa ett inkluderande, fördomsfritt och rättvist urval. Testerna är ett första steg i vår urvalsprocess. Du får en länk till dessa när vi har tagit emot din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter det personliga mötet för att se vilket värde just du kan tillföra PwC men också vad vi kan erbjuda dig. Intervjuprocessen består vanligtvis av flera steg och olika typer av intervjuer. När du träffar HR, har du en kompetensbaserad intervju där vi tittar på personlighetstestet som du genomfört innan intervjun. Vid intervjun med verksamheten får du möjlighet att träffa det aktuella teamet för att gå igenom rollen.

title: System Engineer
description:
**TFS HealthScience** 
 is a global, mid-sized Contract Research Organization (CRO) that partners with biotechnology and pharmaceutical companies throughout their clinical development journey. Our expertise covers full-service solutions, resourcing, and functional service provider (FSP) offerings.
   

  

 We are now seeking a System Engineer
 **(GMP)** 
 to join our team. This assignment involves working on-site with one of our pharmaceutical manufacturing clients. In this role, you will have overall responsibility for the operation, maintenance, and further development of several IT and data systems used in a GMP-regulated environment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage the administration and operation of IT systems linked to regulatory activities
* Ensure data systems comply with current GMP requirements and regulatory guidelines
* Perform qualification and validation of new and existing systems
* Act as an expert resource during inspections and audits from authorities and clients
* Plan and coordinate maintenance, upgrades, and development projects related to data systems
* Handle license administration and documentation
* Contribute to the development of procedures and governing documents (SOPs)
* Train users on systems and support the creation of training materials
* Collaborate with both internal IT functions and external vendors on technical matters and procurement


**System Environment (examples Of Systems In This Role)**
 ECM, Chromeleon, PCS 1, MassLynx, Chemstation, Malvern Mastersizer, Unicorn Äkta Pure, Intab, Panalytical Xpert Pro XRPD, STARe, MicroDiss, Modde, Chemdraw, among others.
   

  

**Your Profile**
* Experience working with data systems in GMP-regulated operations
* Strong understanding of requirements for data management, data integrity, and audit trail in regulated environments
* Experience with validation and qualification of computerized systems
* Ability to document work in line with regulatory requirements and draft governing documents
* Previous experience with inspections and audits is advantageous
* Excellent proficiency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written


**What We Offer**
 We offer a stimulating consulting role where you will have the opportunity to grow both professionally and personally. You will be part of an engaged team where collaboration, competence development, and high quality are central.
   

  

**About TFS HealthScience**
 Founded in Lund over 27 years ago, TFS has grown into a global full-service CRO with more than 800 employees across 40+ countries. We provide flexible solutions in clinical development and strategic resourcing across multiple therapeutic areas such as dermatology, neuroscience, oncology, and ophthalmology.
   

  

 Our values —
 **Trust, Quality, Passion, Flexibility, and Sustainability** 
 — guide everything we do and help us build strong, dedicated teams that make a difference together.
   

  

**Together we make a difference.**

title: Cyber Security Specialist – CyberSOC - Lund
description:
**About Justera Group**
 Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Cyber Security Specialist** 
 to join our CyberSOC team. In this role, you will help develop and operate security monitoring capabilities to protect a complex, global enterprise environment. You will take ownership of the SIEM platform, working with various teams to onboard data, build automation, investigate incidents, and enhance overall cybersecurity posture.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities:****
* Manage and optimize the SIEM platform to detect, investigate, and respond to security incidents efficiently.
* Investigate cybersecurity incidents across infrastructure, networks, operating systems, and cloud environments.
* Translate internal and external threats into actionable risks, ensuring timely resolution.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure smooth integration and operational excellence.
* Provide clear reporting to highlight security trends and address vulnerabilities.
* Ensure compliance with business and regulatory cybersecurity requirements.


****Requirements:****
* Minimum 5 years of cybersecurity experience with hands-on expertise in Cyber Threat Management.
* Proven experience managing SIEM platforms (data onboarding, automation, incident response).
* Broad technical knowledge of infrastructure, networks, operating systems, and cloud environments.
* Experience in incident response, threat detection controls, and risk-based security approaches.
* Familiarity with Agile methodologies and working with development teams.
* Knowledge of Zero Trust principles is a plus.


****Key Competences:****
* SIEM Tools: CrowdStrike, Cribl Edge & Stream, Splunk Core, Splunk Enterprise Security.
* Endpoint Security: CrowdStrike, Palo Alto Cortex XDR, Cylance Protect.
* Cloud Security: Azure Sentinel.
* Security Architecture & Design: Especially for SIEM environments.


****Mandatory Skills (Preferably 3):****
* Security Tools: CrowdStrike, Cribl, Splunk, Cylance, Palo Alto XDR.
* Platforms: Windows, Linux.
* Cloud: Azure.


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: Avdelningschef AI och Data
description:
**Arbetsförmedlingen IT** 
 har en central roll i myndighetens förnyelse. Genom att digitalisera och automatisera bidrar vi till att fler människor kommer ut i arbete. Vi är ledande inom offentlig sektor i användningen av AI och söker nu en chef för den nyetablerade Avdelningen AI och Data.
   

  

**Avdelningschefens uppdrag och ansvar**
 Avdelningen består av ca 80 personer fördelade på två enheter och fem sektioner.
   

  

 Som
 **chef för AI och Data** 
 ansvarar du för att etablera den nya avdelningen. Detta innebär att leda och utveckla myndighetens arbete inom området samt att leda arbetet med att bygga AI-baserad infrastruktur för transaktionskontroll för att främja korrekta utbetalningar.
   

  

 Som chef har du även det övergripande verksamhets-, budget- och personalansvaret för avdelningens verksamhet. Du säkerställer att avdelningens resultat motsvarar fastställda mål och förväntningar.
   

  

 Som avdelningschef ingår du i verksamhetsområde IT:s ledningsgrupp. Ditt arbete sker i starkt partnerskap i och utanför din egen avdelning och i god samverkan med fackliga parter och externa intressenter.
   

  

**Vem söker vi**
 Du är en nyckelperson i vårt viktiga arbete med att transformera vår kultur och våra arbetssätt.
   

  

 Du är har stor teknisk förståelse och vana att arbeta på strategisk nivå inom området. Du är trygg att leda förändringsarbete och har tidigare etablerat nya arbetssätt och verktyg. Du har god förmåga att kommunicera och presentera i tal och skrift. Som person är du lösningsorienterad, driven, uthållig och tar egna initiativ. Du får saker gjorda och arbetar systematiskt och strukturerat. Du är relationsskapande och inger förtroende. Du vågar både fatta beslut och delegera ansvar. En god förmåga att leda och stödja är avgörande för att lyckas i rollen.
   

  

**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten**
 Minst två års aktuell erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Chefskap med verksamhets- och personalansvar på enhetsnivå inom Arbetsförmedlingens verksamhet


 Eller
   

  

* Chefskap på motsvarande nivå med verksamhets- och personalansvar från annan organisation


 Samt
   

  

* Aktuell erfarenhet av att leda en IT-organisation i förändring och erfarenhet av att leda chefer
* Relevant akademisk examen såsom t.ex. Systemvetare, civilingenjör inom Datavetenskap, teknisk fysik eller teknisk matematik. Eller motsvarande erfarenhet förvärvad på annat sätt som arbetsgivaren bedömer som likvärdig och relevant
* Aktuell erfarenhet av strategiskt arbete så som organisationsutveckling, styrmodeller, och affärs/erbjudandeutveckling
* Aktuell erfarenhet av att omsätta strategier till verksamhet; bryta ner i målbilder och konkretisera färdplan för övergripande förändringar
* Aktuell erfarenhet av att ha ansvarat för utvecklandet och leveransen av ett/en större projekt/produkt/tjänst
* Aktuell erfarenhet av data och informationsstyrning


**Övriga meriter för tjänsten**
* Aktuell chefserfarenhet från Arbetsförmedlingen
* Aktuell certifiering inom IT-arkitektur, verksamhetsarkitektur eller informationsarkitektur


 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
   

  

 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


 Chefer är medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen som dessutom:
   

  

* Pekar ut riktning för sina medarbetare och följer upp prestationer
* Undanröjer hinder i vardagen och hanterar problem
* Skapar delaktighet i arbetet och främjar utveckling


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, förtroendearbetstid, samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Då vi är en beredskapsmyndighet kan du komma att bli krigsplacerad i din tjänst.
   

  

 Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

 Säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan komma att genomföras innan anställningen påbörjas.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-10-17.
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
   

  

**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.**
 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: Af-2025/0090 2443 | Kontakt: Krister Dackland, verksamhetsområdeschef krister.dackland@arbetsformedlingen.se, Joel Rydström, rekryteringspartner joel.rydstrom@arbetsformedlingen.se, | Facklig företrädare: Andreas Deniz, Saco-S 010-4862198, Tobias Persson, Seko 010-4880131, Per Samuelsson, ST 010-4869234, | Publicerat: 2025-10-03 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-17

title: Product Specialist
description:
**Job Description:**
**Product Specialist**
**About Us**
 Easit AB is a Swedish software company with first-class consulting within system and business development. With in-house developed products for Enterprise Service Management and Data Management, we deliver powerful solutions to large companies and businesses for both the private and public sector. We’re situated in Sundsvall Stockholm, in Sweden, and have appr. 40 employees.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 The product specialist creates, develops and implements work processes in our product Easit GO. The role can involve both permanent assignments with customers or shorter and parallel assignments in project form. The role works close to the customer, works proactively, and is a catalyst for ideas. The position is placed in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**ROLE RESPONSIBILTILES**
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain long-term customer relationships
* Pay attention to customer needs and come up with solutions
* Configuration / adaptations in Easit GO
* Capture the customer's exact requirements in depth
* To run, facilitate and participate in workshops to find solution proposals for the customer
* Educate customers in the product Easit GO.


**Key Skills & Experience:**
* Proven previous experience as Product Specialist or similar
* Hold a degree or relevant qualification is desirable
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills, both in Swedish and in English
* Good understanding of technology and how it is applied in business
* A genuine IT interest
* Knowledge and experience within Microsoft programs, e.g.AD, Excel, Power BI and Azure
* Experience of working in processes
* ITIL certification is meritorious.


**Personal Attributes:**
* High degree of self-motivation
* Driven, High Energy and enthusiasm
* Honesty and integrity
* Strong customer service mindset
* Enjoys working in a team
* Be able to work independently.


**WHY JONAS SOFTWARE?**
* Be part of a dynamic and innovative global organisation.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.
* Opportunities for career growth within our expansive portfolio.
* Join a collaborative environment that champions diversity, equity, and inclusion, creating a space where everyone can excel.


**What Our Employees Say About Us**
 See what our employees say about us in the highlights video from our Jonas Annual Business Awards 2023 https://www.jonassoftware.co.uk/insights and our ‘Every Person Matters’ video from our Jonas Annual Business Awards 2024 https://www.jonassoftware.co.uk/why-jonas/people-culture/
   

  

**Additional Information**
**LOCATION**
* Remote or Office/Hybrid (ability to travel, sometimes at short notice)
* The position is based in Solna, Sweden.


**Benefits**
* Private Health Insurance
* Health Benefit 5 000 SEK yearly
* Contribution to you home internet connection.
* Mobile phone with 15 GB internet connection and free calls.


**MUCH MORE THAN A BENEFIT**
* Internal Learning & Development programmes
* Internal Mentor programme
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and Mental Health First Aiders to support you
* Jonas Europe & Jonas Global networking events (JABAs, GROW, JSA). Join communities, build networks and collaborate with your colleagues across the Global Group.


**OUR DEIB COMMITMENT**
 Our people define us and, at Jonas, we believe that diversity in all its forms enriches our organisation and drives innovation. We actively seek to create an environment where all employees feel valued, heard, and empowered to contribute their best work. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all. Come and be part of a team where your unique background and experiences are celebrated!
   

  

 We strongly encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, including those from underrepresented groups such as women, ethnic minorities, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ individuals and we are committed to creating an interview and hiring process that is accessible and inclusive for everyone.
   

  

**FLEX WORKS CULTURE**
 Here at Jonas Software UK & Europe, we see flexibility as a game-changer. We truly believe that working flexibly together helps to increase our innovation, growth and productivity, as well as supports our employees’ wellbeing and helps to provide great places to work.
   

  

 For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: working location, number of hours/days worked, different start and finishing times, flexible lunch break arrangements, agreed core hours, flexible hours, an element of working from home.
   

  

 Many of our employees work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want, but we do promise not to judge you for asking.
   

  

**Business Unit:**
 Easit ESM
   

  

**Scheduled Weekly Hours:**
 40
   

  

**Number of Openings Available:**
 1
   

  

**Worker Type:**
 Regular
   

  

**Career Site:**
**More About Jonas Software:**
 Jonas Software is the leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to the Country and Golf Clubs, Foodservice, Construction, Fitness & Sports, Attractions, Salon & Spa, Education, Radiology/Laboratory Information Systems, and Product Licensing industries. Within these vertical markets, Jonas is made up of over 65 distinct brands, which are respected and leaders within their own domain.
   

  

 Jonas’ vision is to be the branded global leader across the aforementioned vertical markets and to be recognized by customers and respective industry stakeholders as the trusted provider of ‘Software for Life’ and as an ambassador for technology, product innovation, quality, and customer service.
   

  

 Jonas Software is the valued technology partner of over 60,000 customers worldwide in more than 30 countries. Jonas employs over 2,000 skilled individuals consisting of a cross-section of industry experts and technology professionals. Jonas is headquartered in Canada and also operates offices throughout North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Australia New Zealand and Africa. Jonas is a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., headquartered in Toronto and traded on the S&P/TSX 60.
   

  

**IS THIS YOU?**

title: Trading system specialist Equities Execution Platform team | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

 Would you like to be in a team of six highly skilled employees working in a fast-paced environment? We are now looking for a team member to the Equities Execution Platform team at SEB Technology to strengthen the technical support & development of the platform.
   

  

 SEB is a full-service investment bank that offers advisory and financing across all products and client segments. We are recognized as one of the leading Nordic banks within investment banking. Within Equities Execution we have a leading market share of institutional flow on Nordic exchanges, and we provide connectivity throughout Europe, North America & Asia.
   

  

**Your Role**
* You will work in a fast-paced work environment and contribute to the continuous delivery of the Equities Execution trading systems.
* Provide end user support and have a very close collaboration with the trading desks and other business stakeholders
* Troubleshooting, system integration, maintenance, installation and configuration for our Equity execution trading systems.
* Implementing and overseeing continuous monitoring to ensure the stability and efficiency of our production environment.
* Collaborating with external vendors, cross-functional teams, other development units to deliver comprehensive solutions.


**Our Ideal Candidate**
* Relevant academic degree with focus on computer and systems science or within the financial sector.
* You have at least 2 years of experience from working in a support role and with system integration.
* Experience of working with trading products within Equities, Fixed Income or FX is meritorious.
* Knowledge of working with Trading applications, platforms, protocols, & containers.
* Especially: Ullink, network, FIX-Protocol, Exchange connections, Linux and Electronic Trading will also be meriting.
* You need to be a service-minded team-player eager to learn new things and able to take on multiple tasks.
* You have a customer focused attitude, is driven, structured and self-going
* You are highly motivated, positive and have a strong sense of responsibility and commitment.
* You have experience from or an interest in the Financial industry.
* You are proactive and contribute with ideas and suggested improvements on our platform and way of working.
* You have excellent communication abilities in both Swedish and English.
* You are familiar with the agile way of working.


**What We Offer**
* Innovative project with highly motivating colleagues
* Exciting work environment with very close business contact
* Extensive training and great learning opportunities
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-10-20. If you have questions about the position, please contact Thomas Erlandsson, Team Manager, at thomas.erlandsson@seb.se
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Customer Technology Advisor Security
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join our dynamic team as a
 **Security Customer Technology Advisor** 
 and become an integral part of our cutting-edge Go-To-Market team. As a certified expert in your field, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing technology solutions for our valued customers. Working hand in hand with our Kyndryl Consult Partners and customer partners, you will leverage your technical and solution expertise to drive targeted opportunities and exceed customer expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you won't just be another advisor; you will be a trusted ally and visionary, delivering unique and differentiated value to our customers. Through captivating show-and-tell methods such as engaging demos and compelling presentations, you will showcase our credibility and eminence in the industry, leaving a lasting impression on potential customers.
   

  

 As a vital member of our team, you will support Consulting, Advisory, and Architecture activities across Sales, Pre-Sales & Delivery, collaborating closely with Customer Partners and Kyndryl Consult Partners. With your extensive technical knowledge and mastery of the security domain, you will bring together the breadth of Kyndryl's expertise to develop profitable deals that drive our success.
   

  

 Your dedication to continuous improvement and your passion for our security practice will shine through as you showcase your end-to-end knowledge of the domain you align with, as well as the associated subdomains. Your technical prowess, backed by your external certifications, will establish you as a true authority in your field.
   

  

 As a
 **Security Customer Technology Advisor** 
 , you will possess strong technical and business acumen, allowing you to provide value driven solutions within the security practice services domain(s). Your exceptional customer facing skills, combined with your articulate communication style and interpersonal finesse, will enable you to effortlessly convey the technical benefits of Kyndryl's capabilities, perfectly matching the unique needs of each customer.
   

  

 As a strategic thinker, you will identify the intricate business and technical requirements of our customers, leveraging the vast capabilities of Kyndryl to generate winning cross-practice solutions. Your ability to develop and deliver compelling demonstrations, proof of concepts, and prototypes will clearly demonstrate the tangible value our offerings bring to our customers, leaving them eager to partner with us.
   

  

 In addition to your technical expertise, you will also take the lead in coordinating the entire pre-sales process, ensuring quality and compliance verification while adhering to Kyndryl best practices. Your collaboration with internal and external stakeholders will generate winning responses and create optimal technical solutions. Moreover, you will actively build and nurture relationships with our external alliance partners, fostering a collaborative environment where joint solutions are co-created.
   

  

 Join our team of forward thinking, tech-savvy professionals and embark on a journey of innovation, growth, and fulfillment. As a
 **S** 
**ecurity Customer Technology Advisor,** 
 you will not only shape the future of technology solutions but also make a meaningful impact on the success of our customers and Kyndryl as a whole.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Deep domain knowledge of Services offerings and technical solutions in the security practice
* Demonstrated experience translating distinctive technical knowledge into actionable customer insights and solutions
* Prior consultative selling experience
* Externally recognized as an expert in the technology and/or solutioning areas, including technical certifications supporting subdomain focus area(s) including: Application Data and AI; Cloud; Core Enterprise and zCloud; Digital Workplace; Network and Edge; Security and Resiliency


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree
* 5 years of experience (minimum) selling technical services for multi-industry customers


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey.
